review_body: We booked this resort out of desperation to just have a timeshare option in expensive Oahu knowing that is had no rating. The good: great location, Murphy bed was surprisingly comfortable, good to have fridge and dishes. The rest: the room is small, old, and although clean in appearance we didn't trust it and covered the furniture and wore socks/shoes in the unit. Not the kind of resort where you will be able to enjoy time in your room. Up in the morning and back at night. They misrepresent the "resort fee" of $200 as a state tax but it is not that and you cannot opt out of paying for it. This allows you to "borrow" a barbie size blow drier and a remote for your TV. They offered local parking for a very cheap rate for the week and we recouped the $200 by attending a vacation club presentation. Nothing was a surprise to us and knew what we were getting when we accepted this trade. Best we could get in the location in the heart of Waikiki.

If you look for a very old fashioned place with indelicate personal, this is it.Rooms are very old with O value material. And on top of this, Josel, the desk manager would say that you are responsible for the already broken furniture and will debit your card without your knowledge and consent. I have clearly been stolen. I asked the desk manager to provide evidence that their material was intact before my checkin and they did not. Worst experience in my lile ever for staying in a hotel.Very noisy at night due to the night club.

First of all the hotel room was clean and quirky. If you are looking for a basic efficiency room with the basics this is your spot. The location is very good. Close to bus stop and international market place as well as Dukes alley and Waikiki beach. The room had a nice kitchen area. The bed was better than I expected as it was a fold down Murphy bed. The check in process was tedious but once you get past that the cost and location are the best. There is an elevator which was nice with lots of luggage. Be aware that there is a resort fee and they place a 250 deposit for security. If you need luxury don’t expect it here. This is basic great value lodging.

We asked for a late check-in when we booked. Got to the hotel 20 minutes after the desk closed and we had no way to get in. Talked to the security guard and he said could help of we paid an extra $45. Even after offering to pay the extortion he couldn't get anyone to help. Spent the night sleeping in the car. Next day we asked for a refund and they said they had no record of our late check-in request and gave no refund. Save yourself some grief and stay anywhere else.

My 10th visit to Hawaii but first to Kuhio Banyan Club. Got this through Travelocity for a very good price. Got a room with a very moldy air conditioner but that was fixed immediately when we were upgraded to a double room suite. Staff here is great...they will do everything to help. Location is perfect...immediately across the street from the international market and 5 minute walk to beach at Royal Hawaiian Hotel. We got the kitchenette and it was stocked with everything needed to cook. The rooms are fairly old but well maintained. The only downside I see is that there is a night club on the first floor and it gets fairly loud but I think it depends where your room is and what time you are returning. Also, wifi is a bit slow but I think, it too, is on Hawaiian time.

I was very disappointed in having a studio hotel instead of a 2 bdrm unit. There was a bed that let down from the wall in the same room as the sofas and table. We slept on the couches because they were more comfortable. The mini fridge did not get cold. It was awful. They charged us 450 at check in. 239 resort fee and 200 for amenities when there was no amenities all at the hotel.

We got a standard studio room, was pleasantly surprised at the space and cleanliness. Although a bit outdated it was worth the money. I think the having to pay extra for coffee when staying more than 2 days was a bit cheeky. Staff were friendly and welcoming.

We found BED BUGS at Kūhiō Banyan Hotel!!! Stay away!! Even worse, management is rude, terrible and will not refund you for used OR unused nights, even if you bring live bugs to the front desk and show that you were bitten. Talk about a health hazard. The clerk actually tried to insinuate we brought them in, which is so wrong. We’re fastidious people who react badly to the bites, so I can 1000% guarantee we did not bring those bugs in. We never have ANY pest control problems at home.Their only solution was to switch our room, which we declined because bed bugs can travel between walls. How could they guarantee another room was bug free? 1/3 of people don’t react to the bites, so no complaints don’t mean no bugs. And how many guests were unaware and mistook the bites for something else? After how we were treated, the trust was gone.We made the mistake of choosing this hotel instead of a national chain because we wanted a kitchenette and to support a local business. Never again. The rest of our group went to national chains with zero problems.Things other reviewers complained about that we were willing to overlook:1. The nightclub downstairs that pumps the bass with clubgoers screaming from 1-3:30am. We were far enough away, it was just tolerable. But I can’t imagine being in the rooms right above the club.2. Noisy downtown location in front of a busy bus stop (constant traffic)3. Dated decor and run down, slummy apartments right next door4. Can’t open windows & the window AC can just barely keep up with the heat5. Bathroom jalousie windows are stuck open with no other ventilation so the bathroom stays humid and smelly6. Hot water takes forever to come on7. Front desk closes at 10pm so if you need anything you’re SOL until the morning or $45 new key charge. Don’t get locked out!8. No free parking included or anywhere nearbyWe were ok dealing with all of that, but BED BUGS are a dealbreaker! To ensure we didn’t bring them home (they can be a nightmare to get rid of), we had to throw away our luggage and ziplock all our belongings at the airport, then wash & dry everything at the laundromat before taking it home. At least we saw them. Can’t imagine all the people staying here who may be taking bed bugs home unaware.

Lovely place to stay, we stayed here for our stay in Hawaii. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good location which is located close to a bus route.Only negative thing was we paid for 17 postcards to be posted back to the U.K but now almost 5 weeks have passed with no one receiving any of the 17 handed for posting?

This motel (not a "club" so much) is located in a spectacular spot right in the heart of downtown Honolulu, in the midst of all the restaurants and shopping! Therefore, the price paid is a pretty decent value. The property itself is dated and basic, but perfectly fine if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room (and in Hawaii, why would you?). There are Murphy beds, freshly vacuumed carpets, full kitchenettes, and comfy couches-- all you could want for a stay where you don't need luxury, but just a place to sleep. Staff are acceptably friendly.However, there are two caveats-- 1.) the Front Desk is not 24/7, so if you lose your key or arrive after 10:00 pm, you are out of luck! They will charge you a fee for letting you into your room. 2.) They charge you a resort fee. It isn't much compared to other hotels in the area, but since this is not even close to a resort-- for instance, there is no pool or hot tub-- I am not sure what these charges are supposed to be for. Others have complained about the noise from the nightclub next door but I was not bothered. However, I am a very sound sleeper!

Not worth the price I'd paid for a time share. With the cost of "time share" including exchange fees and all other fees, a hotel by the beaches would be much more pleasant at less money. The front desk was only opened during business hours. My unit was on the 3rd floor. I'd placed garbage outside front door and a homeless person walked into my unit. I chased him out and called a report to closed ears.

If your looking for low cost accommodation and are not concerned about the creature comforts, this is the place for you. Centrally located in Waikiki, close to public transport and endless shopping opportunities. Air conditioning is insufficient. Bed is a fold down bed. Mattress and pillows were old and uncomfortable. The decor is old and very dated.

Walking distance to all Waikiki attractions, right across the International Market Place. Many bus routes available right in front of the resort. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Parking is metered, off the street but very limited.

On a main city street, and hard to find. No parking on site and local lot is a machine paid $18 a day or get towed. Noisy with not only street noises but also close to apartments and street performers. Not for someone seeking beach, peace or quiet. Murphy bed pulls down from the wall and fills the living room floor space. Small kitchenette, with very small appliances.

Extremely rude manager. Broken doors on cabinets. Dirty dishes and basically dirty in general. Was moved to new room in the middle of our stay and was forced to store our luggage in office at 10 AM and sit in lobby until our room was finally ready at 2 PM. TV remote did not work.

The only time I will recommend this to you is if you get a good deal in booking websites. Just so you can save some more for your Honolulu adventures—I assume we all are out for the rest of the day. However, if you are the type that stays longer inside the hotel than outside, then this will not be a bang-for-your-buck deal. I really like the staff. They were all helpful esp. when my friend got towed, they provided all the help we needed. Their baggage/luggage room seemed pretty secure to me too. Another plus would be the location since it's just how many minutes walk to the beach, and everything else is accessible or walkable from their point.I did not like the AC, the size (and obviously horsepower) was not suitable for the spaciousness of the room. Our room needed a ceiling fan support at all times. Nighttime can be challenging because by 8 P.M. there is no lobby/frontdesk staff anymore. Plus, they have a club/bar beside them which can get pretty loud and rowdy.

I’m giving them two starts because the staff at this location are friendly and polite. The Kuhio Banyan Club is old and not very well maintained. Paint is peeling in the room and the shower has stains. The carpet in the hallways are stained. Furniture and mattress are old and worn. You only get two packs of coffee even though you stay there two weeks. After that you’ll have to pay. Very expensive parking unless you are lucky to get one of the very limited and time restricted street spots.

The check in staff were very helpful. They had put us far from the nightclub which is what I was grateful for.The room is aged with a very noisy air con. The Murphy bed was different not having slept in on one before. It took most of the living space. The kitchen was clean, tidy and plenty of utensils to work with.The bathroom very old and we killed a couple of cockroaches. Never seen any so big in my life before.Wi if was free. Being in the centre of town it was within walking distance of everywhere or we caught a bus to AlaMoana. It was great.

Please read this before booking.1) Rooms are absolutely disgusting.  Not clean, lots of dust, and stained carpet.2) They lie about thier rooms online. Doesn't sleep two as they offer one day bed that pulls out from a closet.3) Air condition doesn't work because they use window units that are to small for the size of the room. They have air cons with the wrong BTU. Get used to heat. They offered to give me a fan but the advertisement clearly states air conditioning. 4) Super bad location because of loud night club below the hotel.My recommendation is to not stay here and find another place to stay regardless of the price.

Can't beat the location so close to Waikiki Beach and all of the shopping well within walking distance. The resort is old and tired but she keeps providing an excellent value for trading. Very close to public transportation and activities yet quiet and comfortable. Excellent choice for budget with small kitchen and its air conditioned.

I checked into the Kuhio Banyan Club on June 5th-10th. Actually one of the Front Desk Clerks saw me trying to find the front door came out and helped me in. The front desk employee were so nice and very helpful;. They knew there job was to make you comfortable and they knew there job. Very friendly and knowledgeable of there job. The room was very clean and the housekeeping was excellent the housekeeping employee very nice and a smile each time she came to door to clean. I was very pleased with my room and this trip and would stay there again. Location was also a factor middle of everything and all bus lines. I give this place a 10+. Thanks you made my trip the best.

quite a nice place in the heart of Honolulu, you were in the middle of everything, the staff was nice and the room was surprisingly very clean and above what I expected for the price we paid for this room.

Judging by the pictures I was expecting a studio and was given a one bedroom 2 bath condo. This was also in a perfect place for access to the beach. It is situated in essence on the 50 yard line for Waikiki Beach!

The location is convenient to Waikiki and many other places in Honolulu. I lived in Hawaii for a while as a teenager and never had much use for Waikiki. It has gotten steadily worse in terms of non-high-end shopping activity in the many visits since then. There is no parking, which is common to many other properties in the area. Getting into the resort is a bit odd, since you have to go past other tourism-related businesses, including a night club. Once inside, it need some upkeep. The Murphy bed was very comfortable but made badly. Stovetop was a surprise. Employees were very nice, the strong point of the premesis.

the kuhio banyan club is in the heart of Waikiki beach area- 5 minute walk to beachthe shopping area is variedthe hotel has a great bunch of guys that man the deskthe lady cleaning our floor was very goodthe paia fish market restaurant across the street was so good we ate there 5 times try the fresh catch of the daybusses and trolleys stop very near resort-there is no need for a car when you stay at the kuhio banyabuses take you to the popular sites- diamond head -pearl harbor-the largest outdoor shopping mall in the united statesthe kuhio is in a great location and will stay there again

we recently stayed at the Kuhio banyan club for 2 weeks - it is not a five star hotel by any means but it is very clean, comfortable and in our opinion a superb location. Blocks from the beach and plenty of walking to restaurants in the area. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. In particular Jesse is so friendly and always waves when we returned from an outing. They have beach towels, chairs, umbrella and boogie boards that we used. In addition we used the laundry facility which was helpful. Def would recommend for someone wanting to spend less on a room that you barely spend time in. We would go here again

My boyfriend and I stood here for 7 nights. The staff was very polite and helpful. The rooms have a kitchen which some people take for granted with the crazy food prices in Waikiki. We were going to rent a car but the bus lines and the Waikiki trolley were right in front or 1 block away depending on the route. Housekeeping always took care of our essentials. This hotel is not luxurious but it has everything you need for a very good price in the middle of everything in Waikiki. You can save your money to do all the activities and shopping because the prices of other well known hotels in the area are ridiculous.

I recently visited Hawaii for the 4th time and stayed at the Kuhio Banyan from April 30 to May 7, 2019. This was my second time staying at this hotel. Although the hotel is a little run-down, it was very comfortable and clean. My room was charming and included a kitchenette which was stocked with everything I needed. I stayed in room 208. I ran into a little problem on my 2nd day and the staff was very respectful, understanding and went out of their way to ensure my comfort. They resolved the issue immediately. This hotel is in a fantastic location...only one block from the beach and in the middle of the tourist hub. Not only that, the hotel will provide all the necessary beach equipment. I had checked the reviews of this hotel before booking and cannot understand why some guests had said the staff was very rude, especially the female staff at the front desk. I had interactions with all staff, including the female desk clerk, the male clerks, housekeeping and maintenance staff and everyone was not only friendly but respectful. I can only conclude that the guests were probably the ones being rude. You reap what you sow. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Nice rooms. There is no parking for this resort. Check with staff for some options for parking. We enjoyed the our trip because we had a comfortable room to relax in. We also liked that they have beach toys and towels that we could borrow, big savings.

Kuhio is in a great spot in Waikiki, literally all the expensive hotels are around the corner, and is about 2 times higher because of its name. If you are looking to spend more money on the your experience than hotel, this is a place you should look into. The only problem I had is they are next to a club, and if you are sleep on a Saturday night by 2 am it is LOUD due to the club letting out. That's the only issue I had, the staff was great and very helpful. If you are looking for luxury this is not the place. If you are looking for an affordable, clean place to stay, then by all means stay here. You can walk around the corner from this hotel and Harry Winston is right there, all the upscale and popular store are around the corner from this hotel. Hope this is helpful.

is not for me to say you should send your stuffs to check it out yourself,im not comfortable to address any of this is not my job, this to too much to ask d the customer to so this is to too long, your are making me mad , I DON'T WANT TO SAY ANY MOR!!!!!!!

I will never come back to this resort again..Sorry This building is to old it's not what I'm expect..I have no other words to say about this crappy resort need to be shot down. Rep should let owner to know has no parking spaces on this resort.

We booked a cheap package with Jetstar which lobbed us into this little place in central Waikiki. It's a bit like a 1970s three star motel but the location, friendly staff and facilities more than made up for first impressions. The Kuhio Banyan features a kitchen and every utensil needed, a good bathroom, safe, flat screen TV and - our first experience with a Murphy bed which pulls down from a closet. This hideaway bed was very comfortable and during the day enabled guests to have a much bigger living area. The hotel was only a few paces from our favorite Japanese restaurant and across the road from a food hall where the bar features $2 beers throughout the day. There are several adjoining restaurants. The Kuhio Banyan is only a block and a half from Waikiki Beach. I'll stay there on future visits to Honolulu.

I booked at 11pm for check in the same night, a very last second booking because of an issue with my flight. I was down the block when I booked it and arrived 5 minutes later. The hotel was locked and there was no employees there. Turns out there's no check-in after 10pm. WHY WOULD THEY ALLOW ME TO BOOK AFTER 10PM THEN? They took my money for a reservation they never planned to fulfill.The most maddening part was both the hotel and Agoda refused to refund the booking. Of course I submitted a credit card dispute and it got reversed by the credit card issuer right away.

Very good location, friendly and helpful staff, very clean place and very nice and clean rooms.Only down side is that you cannot lie on the bed and watch TV which I love doing.The room had a Murphy bed and the TV was on the same console as the bed could not watch it in bed. You has to sit on the couch or the chair.

Truly disappointed thought when I was looking for places to stay this would be ideal, but how could it be when people are loud and obnoxious... At 1-3 am with a 5 year old... I don't understand how the staff at this place can even consider to be respectable or at least should mention don't come with kids... I came to enjoy a family vacation not be irritated and woken by morons inconsiderate of others completely disappointed and no one should come to this place save your money and can enjoy a day at the most renown resort at Aluani.

This place is rated low because of the dance club below it on the street. While the noise at 2 or 3 AM was an issue, everything else about the place was just fine, nice little kitchenette, the Murphy bed was fun and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was very good - there were plenty of nice divisions within walking distance and the is a great Japanese Noodle place next door.

This place is not located at the beach but it is walkable to it. It is a great place shop and look around. The bad part is the noise. There is a club at the lower level. Some how the sound travels up the building. It was just as loud in my room as in the club. It will not stop until after 2:00 A.M. I could here people having sex in the next room. I do not think they were trying to be loud but the walls are thin. I understand all that but what I could not understand, that I was charged for stain on floor that was there when I arrived. They charged my card $300.00 for a stain that was clearly there for awhile. Stay here if you want to chance it but you may be spending an extra $300.00 for damage that you did not commit.

This hotel is on Kuhio and fairly centrally located in Waikiki but not close to the beach. I have travelled often to Waikiki from the mainland over the last 40 plus years and noticed prices have gone up consistently even for bare bones locations. The hotel lobby is not open 24 hours but your key will get you in the entrance next to the lobby to a small elevator and stairway. Just check on operating hours if you plan to arrive late. The folks working there seemed friendly. There are many eateries nearby which is convenient. The room I had, was a very dated kitchenette with a fold down murphy bed which was not counter balanced. If you cant lift (lower) much then be very careful. The doors covering the bed were looking like they might come off the hinges. The shower floor had been repainted but was peeling pretty well. There is little ventilation other than some old style slotted vented window above the shower which does not operate. The A.C. was a bit noisy. The safe did not work. The kitchen is functional and equipped. The TV is not a flat screen but the old glass tube type. The stereo has a cassette player. The pillows were very lumpy. The walls are thin so if your neighbors are fighting it can get interesting. (It was) The worst part of my stay was the carpet was not clean, bring flip flops or better, it was dirty to the point I would not walk barefooted. There was a huge brown carpet stain next to the bed. Here comes the really bad part. I got home today and was called about the stain in the carpet. I explained that it was there when I got the room. You could tell it was an old stain and I figured it was the price of staying in a low rent room. It was explained to me that the stain was not previously reported by housekeeping and therefore it was my liability. I again repeated the stain was already there. I was then asked what caused the stain. I could not believe this and then was told my $250 security deposit would be held and kept. Now I need to find an expert to prove this stain was already there which is going to be difficult. I was looking to see on previous posts if this a scam but at this point am asking for a back up from any one who has stayed in room 406 or any cleaner who has seen this stain before. Please please, post it here. There will likely be a follow up on this as the outcome has not been resolved. Beware! Thanks!

Much improved from our last visit several years ago.Great location for food,activities,beach.Staff were great.This is not a resort,but has laundry and equipment to use.Noise from bar downstairs is a pain at times but mostly Friday nights.

The location is superb, downtown Waikiki, within walking distance to shopping, the beach, and the best Japanese Udon noodle restaurant on the island. Staff was polite and the unit was clean. Although the facility is dated, and near a club that can cause noise in the evenings, the location for the price is hard to beat. Great stay--

First impression doest count in this case. Not much to look at. Accomodation pretty good. Dropdown bed comfortable. Stove, fridge, microwave. Adjoining rooms great. International market right across street. Nice walk to beach. Trolleys good/ check web for pricing. KUHIO and KALAKAUA are two main streets downtown. PLENTY of eateries very close. NO PARKING. VERY EXPENSIVE.

It was a good location and I thought I got a good deal booking it with the Jetstar flight. The room itself was ok, with kitchen facilities and a bed-in-the-wall pull down.I was given Room 317. It was two floors above The Playground nightclub, unbeknown to me when I booked. The noise from the nightclub was incredible, with bongo drums banging to well after 2.00 A.M., when I finally passed out! The thing is-they didn't have to give me that room- there were others further along, away from the noise.Next morning, I noticed that the manageress was asking everyone leaving about their stay....she didn't ask me, for some reason!The manageress also held me up for waiting for my room for over an hour. She confused me with someone who was waiting to be picked up. Never again for me!

Is a great place to shower, sleep and prepare meals. There is s small kitchen with stove that all suit their purpose. The shower is extremely small and there is no ventilation in the bathroom really but all in all it's great for the price due to location. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

At first, I had a quite good impression. The location of the Kuhio Banyan Club is good and the room was actually a nice size. But during the two nights we stayed here we had a) almost no Wi-Fi and although we asked to restart the router it kept being unstable and at times pretty much inexistent. B) there is a night club right below the rooms and we felt the vibrations of the music until 4am, which kept us awake. The cockroach in the bathroom was just another disappointment to the overall experience. We were glad to have booked just a few nights and could therefor move to another place...

The location is great, we walked everywhere. The office was great, they let us check in late, check out early, and we made use of the boogie boards, towels and chairs. Very happy with our stay. Would for sure go ahead.

Started by wandering around Oahu from 7.00am until 2.30pm after a flight from Australia before I could get into room, then found out it was on 2nd floor right infront of the bus stop, so whenever the bus arrived and idled the room shook, asked to be moved to another room and was told no rooms available. Next day I went back and asked again for a different room and 2 young guys were there and yes there was a room to move to, it was on the 4 floor above the nightclub, no noise from there so the rest of the trip was bearable. Really old hotel, that really needs an update or a bulldoze

What a let down to arrive at our hotel for our vacation to Hawaii to find a dilapidated hotel in desperate need of repair and updating and views of the bar roof and run down apartments abutting the facility. This is far from a resort. Very disappointed in using saved points from RCI to book our stay not knowing its condition. Nights were miserable because of the Korean food smells from the restaurant on the first floor as well as the noise from the Playboy Bar on the main floor. On the bright side our follow up hotel had availability to check in early so we could leave this place.

If it were the last place in Hawaii I would not go there again. I exchanged a unit in the top 15% with 3 bedrooms in Queenstown Central and got a bedsit (studio) with a flip out bed. Noisy location with no noise canceling in the room

This place reminded me of a cheap Vegas hotel - no view (unless you like the city bus stop outside your only small window. Hotel entry is like a cheap storefront. Entry and exit at the back of the hotel overlooks other cheap hotels/apartments with garbage and laundry everywhere. Air conditioner struggles to keep up, so expect to be warm, and it's also really loud. You'll need ear plugs to sleep, if you can sleep on the thin, lumpy mattress and pillows. There's also a nightclub downstairs but we couldn't hear them over the street and A/C. No pool, laundry like a sweatshop, no real amenities at all. Do yourself a favor and pay just a little more - you'll have a much better time. On the good side, there's a lot to do on the island so you don't spend much time there.

First, there is no safe in ANY room. We had room 416. 3 floors above the club.We could hear the base until 3:45am every morning. Housekeeping twice week. And at check out, they charge you a resort fee of 15$/night.The reception closes at 10pm and it smells horrible The room was clean, bed was comfortable but we needed sleeping pills and white noise app to get us thru the nights.The very positive side is it's location. 5 minutes on foot from the famous Waikiki beach.

Had a nice week in Waikiki staying at KBC. Convenient to public transportation options for getting around on island tours, very engaging and helpful staff, WiFi, a short walk to the beach and shopping, room was as advertised, facility a bit dated, but we mostly just slept there and were busy out and about. A great week!

Very centrally located, close to the beach and walking distance to a lot of shopping and restaurants. Hotel has all the amenities of an apartment. Kitchen was fully stocked. Has daily house keeping service. Lots to do around the hotel.

This is a very old property. Murphy bed was a little weird. You got the remote and hair dryer at the front desk at check in and had to return when checking out. No one works overnight at the desk. Bathroom really needs updating and reno's!! Sketchy area. Cab had trouble finding this place, kind of tucked in off main street. Was cheap so I guess you get what you pay for. It was near restaurants and not far from the beach, but so are a lot of other hotels.

Made a reservation here a couple months or so ahead of time. However, a couple days before I was to go on my trip with my new wife my Guard unit and I got activated to assist with the fires that are consuming California. Being that it was within the cancellation window (by less than 24 hours I might add) I called the hotel to ask if they could cancel the reservation without penalty being that this is an unusual situation and I was legally obligated to report. The hotel's answer? No, we're charging you the full $1000+ dollars for the week with no refunds whatsoever. They said they're was a slight chance that they might give me a credit. Problem is I don't know when I can go again so I have a high risk of losing a $1000 anyway. They also said they want copies of orders, ID and other stuff before they would consider anything at all. I was hoping I heard it wrong and this was a misunderstanding, but I've called twice and essentially been told in an indirect and rude way to "F off" and "Go away" and "We don't give a crap about you or your military obligations." This is when I could even get someone on the phone. I've lost my money apparently, but I am trying to get the word out on every review site I can to keep people away from this business, protect their money and not get screwed over. Thanks Kuhio, I'm glad you have the spirit of Aloha.

Don't believe the bad reviews. This place was highly accommodating and everything we needed. Spacious bathroom, kitchen and lounge room. If you request a room away from the club you wouldn't know it was there. The staff were wonderful they always said hello and goodbye. The housekeeping ladies were also lovely.Very pleased with my stay here.

Very Noisy with Club Downstairs. Feel unsafe without Security officer downstairs while strange people Clubbing during Friday-Sunday and incident with Male from Club who sneaked behind us while opening Locked Door to enter the building and drunk stranger male asking for restroom to use and I got scared telling him to get out and told him there is No Public Restroom in the hotel. Dirty rug hallway and Unit is hot with weak air conditioner. Very small studio for a couple. Rate hotel with *1 Star only and we will not return in this Unsafe and Noisy place with Club Downstairs with Doozy clubbers.

Third stay. Comfortable, friendly, familiar. A little bit like coming home. Is not new or fancy, or "upscale" but it does provide a place to relax between beach visits and a place to cook for yourself; this is the place! Everything you need is provided in a studio setting. Bring aloha, and a swimsuit.

Los Ranchos de Albuquerque, New Mexico

review_body: Although modest in accommodations, the resort is well-maintained and clean. It is in the shadows (literally) of much larger hotels/condos at Waikiki, but is very convenient to transportation and the beach.The staff are EXCELLENT!

Hotel is cheapest in town best location near the beach and shops but it has a night club next door since Abit noisey Saturday night. For the price and the location I would go back again has everything you need in the rooms they are big enough and very clean just do not get house keeping each day

If you want to stay in an old, rundown facility and waste your points... then this is the place for you. This is not a resort but a very cheap, extremely low quality motel. This is not an acceptable resort. I felt very deceived by RCI.

We stayed at Kuhio Banyan Club using our RCI points. The hotel is about 10 minutes walking distance from the beach and there are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and comfortable, but needs updating. They have put in new flat screen TVs that you can watch from your bed (other reviews have commented negatively about the location of the TVs, but they have fixed this). The furniture, carpet, painting, etc are quite outdated. The resort is over a nightclub that plays loud music until about 3-4 am. We had a noise app on our phone that blocked most of the noise. The location and staff friendliness made this a good choice for us.

This hotel is close to the beach, shops and restaurants. The bus stop is right in front of it. Our room was spacious with two sofa lounges, a big table and chairs. There were a microwave oven, a fridge, and a kitchenette, which is perfect for simple cooking.But one of the negative points about the room was the movable pull-down bed. I don’t understand why they can’t provide a proper fixed bed as there is enough space for it. The air-conditioner was too small and not strong enough for a room of this size. It was quite hot in the first 5 hours after we turned on the air-cond. We had to close the bathroom door to reduce the area that was air-conditioned, but then this made the bathroom hot and stuffy. From the 6th hour on, the room gradually got cooled down. Another user-unfriendly thing was the switches of the lamps. It was so difficult to find them and they were too tight to switch on and off. While we were there, the Wi-Fi connection in our room was lost. I reported this to the front desk. They said some other guests had made the same complaint but the technician could not come as it was a Sunday . They suggested that I could try accessing Wi-Fi outside the elevator on the third floor. I tried and it helped. That was the spot where the Wi Fi was the strongest. As I was using WiFi outside the elevator, a lady carrying a baby came and asked me if I was having the same problem as she – a power failure in the room. It seems that the hotel is always having problems of some kind. Despite all this, the friendly and helpful staff, the unbeatable location and the affordable price make this hotel a good choice for the budget travelers.

Dirty!!!! I would never stay in something like this. I walked in the room turned around and went back to check in and checked right back out. I rather spend money on something expensive that is nice and neat than be in this junk! Shower was nasty too.

The room was clean and perfect for what we needed. The kitchenette was great for small snacks and quick breakfasts. We would stay there again. The staff were wonderful and right there when we needed help

This was a last minute trip and it was very good. I would stay there again.very close to the beach. Was able to park my rental car in a garage one block away as they have a guy who rents the spots out. Very good for down town.

This property is right in the middle of Waikiki, two blocks from the beach. The unit was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. But this is not a resort in any sense of the word. The unit was an old motel unit with a partial kitchen. Carpeting and furniture were well worn.This just is not up to the quality I have become accustomed too. There is a nightclub on the lower level and while they block off part of the courtyard at night with a sign that says

review_body: The Resort was very nice transport was a problem without a hire car, this should be included in the guidelines for people who are unable to drive. Local buses are available regular and well priced. Local coffee is not great but whole sale is best it is better than most coffee available in the US of A.

This place is NOT a resort and should not be labeled as one! I plan to send pictures of our room and accommodations to the CEO of RCI. I would like to see if he or she would take their family to this location for their Hawaiian vacation. To make matters worse, we had to use 3 years worth of points to get this place! Internet service was poor, no pool, no restaurant, poor cooling in the room, and the noise from the bar below awakened us every night during our stay. This place is located across the street from Saks Fifth Avenue in Waikiki of all places. The building should have been demolished years ago. My overall opinion is that RCI is a scam.

You're better off paying more money than staying at this hotel. I was charged a bogus fee of $250 because my room "smelled" like smoke and I don't smoke. It also took them 5 hours to call me and tell me they were charging me, even though the room was supposedly checked "immediately" after I checked out..

We had our doubts on 1st arrival but we really appreciated the great location and the positive experience. 2 blocks away from the beach, restaurants all over the place, International Market Place literally across the street. Make sure to take advantage of all the amenities.

Stayed for 7 nights.Good ;1. Nothing beat the location. It is just less than a minute walk to the bus stops and the shops and the restaurants. It is a good 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. NO WAY you can make it in two minutes to the beach. 2. The price is moderate even if you add up the resort fee. Comparing to other hotels around I was able to save some dollars.3. The hotel staff were okay..KIRIN was friendly..(not sure if i spelled his name correctly).4. Bed is comfortable. Room was clean with a kitchenette complete with utensils. Shower has good water pressure.5. It is quiet .. I slept well. Not Good;1. Check-out time is 10 am. Requested for an extension for one hour and woman at counter said NO . I stayed there for seven nights and I checked-in like 6:00 pm the first day and this woman didn't even allow me to extend the check out time for an hour.Not sure if you can call this a positive customer service. 2. There is a small lizard in the bathroom. It always appear every time i use the bathroom. See attached pictures.3. TV is placed beside the headboard ..no way you can watch tv while laying on the bed. See attached pictures again. First time in my travelling life that i've stayed in a hotel where a tv is positioned this way. 4. Room has no view front or back. See attached pictures.5. After 10 pm and you misplaced your keys, they will charge you an additional $45 to access your room.6. And lastly, that particular week they were installing boxes for the tv. and it really was a disturbance because the maintenance guy was a bit pushy in letting the technicians install the boxes inside our room.My Verdict: You can stay or not stay in this hotel. Nothing fancy , my room is simple and clean. The price 'though maybe cheaper has many side fees . Just keep this into consideration. Leaving your room untidy when you check out will get you a hefty fine. Even if you left the beach towel in the beach or you accidentally packed the tv remote in your luggage, all of this will garner you additional fees. This is my honest review or experience of this hotel when i stayed here. I stayed there from Feb 17th to the 24th. And my room was at the fourth floor. Don't forget to check my attached photos they will help you in your decisions.

The employees of this hotel (especially Jessie) are so rude and dishonnest! He lied straight up to our face about extra fees... And the rooms are ugly and smelly. Just don’t go there. Worst experience.

Room is really spacious with a sofa & table.Small kitchenette with microwave. Can cook or heat food easily.Toilet is clean. USP is the location, waikiki beach is just 2 mins walking, ABCD store is just across the road, bus stop in front, Subway is in front & plenty of eateries are on the both side of the road. Tea coffee are available in the room.We checked in 3 hours early, but they never charged anything extra. If you need an adapter can ask the reception. If they have spare they issue it for you, with your singnature.For more updates can view my insta profile traveltipsy.

If you want a fancy-schmancy room and want to say you paid top dollar, go somewhere else. If all you care about is a clean room with a good mattress close to the beach, stay at Kuhio Banyan. We can afford more expensive lodging but would rather spend our money on food and touring. Rooms are essentially studio apartments with Murphy bed( decent foam-mattress- slept VERY well!). Microwave, fridge, dishes, coffee pot, tv. No little shampoo bottles- but body wash dispenser is in the shower and hand soap dispenser on the counter. Furniture looks straight out of the 1950's- 60's...but WHO CARES??? Staff was SUPER friendly and pointed us to the great, inexpensive, local food close at hand. Noodle shop right in front, a $4.95 breakfast just a few minutes walk, and a Korean BBQ inside the nearby grocery. $15 resort fee gets you free use of nice BIG beach towels (like real beach towels, not little bath ones), beach chairs with carry strap, beach umbrella, floaties, boogie boards, etc. We stayed a "THE" local resort and had to pay extra to use beach chairs even with a $30/ day resort fee!. You will see other reviews that diss the decor... I call it Hawaii kitsch.It was clean, that is all I care about! Who cares if the elevator is small? Really? You paid under $100 a night for a room walking distance to Waikiiki Beach and everything you need! We stayed on Saturday and Sunday night- hubby heard the nightclub, but I was so exhausted from the trip and sand/sun, I never heard it. ( he noticed it, but it didn't keep him from sleeping, I fell asleep first). You won't get a room with a view, but let's face it- the views are NOT in the room- they are on the beach! We will be back to Kuhio Banyan- and we look forward to it!

The hotel itself is ok. However, my room (317) was directly over a loud night club located on the premises on the first floor. The earth shattering music starts around 11pm and lasts into 4am. I could not sleep during this time. The vibration of the music rattled the walls. DO NOT GET A ROOM INTO THE TEENS. My room was 317 which was directly over the club. So your room should be 313 or less. I believe there are four floors. Worst hotel expetience of my life.

As a single guy who needed a place to stay for three days for surfing trip, this hotel was perfect for me. Location was amazing for the price I paid. Furniture is very outdated but it was very clean. I read all reviews here so I was ready for all things might go wrong, such as solid ear-plugs, it did get noisy early morning between 3.30 and 4am when dance club next door closed. Staff was very friendly. I did not mind $15 resort fee, you can get towel, chair, umbrella from the hotel, you would pay at least 30 if you rent at the beach. Wifi worked well. TV has good number of channels but it's old and once you are in "fold-up" bed, you cannot see the TV. Overall, I would stay here again if i am having a solo trip and looking for a clean place to sleep for a very reasonable price.

Dated hotel, a sickly sour/sweet smell in the room, thumping bass from the nightclub directly below until 3:30am, less than courteous staff, an additional $15 “resort fee” that no one could justify the mandatory charging of, no safety deposit box in room - actual quote from front desk when asked “well, there might be one, but it won’t be working”.This is very centrally located, loads of shops and restaurants all around. Apart from that, and unless you like the things described above, STAY AWAY.

This hotel is located in the middle of Waikiki, and for the price, this place is a great deal. We needed a room for half of the day until our late evening flight, so I booked the Kuhio Banyan Club the day before. Our room was ready even though we arrived a little before standard check-in time of 4pm. The third floor room facing Kuhio was larger than I expected, and was very quiet even though there are stores and restaurants on the first floor, and a busy bus stop in front of the hotel. Kitchenette was convenient and bathroom had only a shower, no tub. Furnishings were older, but clean overall. Wifi worked great in the room. The front desk does close at 10pm (there is a number to call in case of emergencies). The main door gets locked after 10pm, so all guests do get keys to the front door. I also saw a security guard walking around, so safety was never a concern. There is an elevator in the lobby.If you are on a budget or just need a place to get some rest, this is a great place to stay. Staff is very nice and they do have bag storage. It was about half the price of the next cheapest hotel in Waikiki. A cab ride to the airport was about $37.

My family and I stayed here for 2 nights and the entire facility left lots to be desired. The elevator is more like a narrow closet, so you either have to make several trips to get your luggage upstairs, or shove everything in there as best you can. The room itself made us feel like we took a step back a few decades in time. There are mirrors EVERYWHERE. One wall was covered completely with mirror, and then a lattice covered that mirror entirely. The bed is in the living area with the couches, and it was a Murphy bed. It came out of wooden doors with again, mirrors on the outside. Not very comfortable, and the pillows were awful. Sleeping on the couch was more comfy, but I wish the couches had been sofa beds themselves. The bathroom was literally nothing but mirrors. You can see yourself everywhere except for in the shower itself. But as soon as you step out of the shower, there's your reflection on the wall. Same thing when you're sitting on the toilet... You're facing yourself. Also, the shower is raised about a foot and a half off the floor, so it's sort of steep when you're stepping out of it. The whole hotel just seemed to have an outdated and murky feel to it. And I know it's out of their control if it's not on their property, but the alleyway behind the hotel is full of trash and smells very, very strongly of urine. It was offsetting whenever you'd be walking to and from your room. So with all of that being said, the front desk staff is what made our stay there enjoyable. Jesse was particularly helpful as he was able to suggest different places to go, such as restaurants and different sections of the beaches that wouldn't be as packed as the rest of Waikiki. He also helped us find cheaper food on some menus of nearby restaurants. So thank you, Jesse. Your friendly and honest hospitality is what redeemed the hotel.

My mother and I stayed here in June 2017.Honestly, for the price you pay (1/2 of what other hotels around the area cost) this place is great. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are big with working air con and the area is perfect. Walking distance to a lot of areas including the beach and shopping and bus stops right outside. Am planning a trip to Hawaii again next year and will be staying here without a doubt. Yeah, you pay a deposit but its just a hold on a card that they remove quickly. Bargain hotel!! Get amongst it.

The hotel is a little dated but everything worked properly and the fold-down bed was comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed four nights and would definitely do so again. Our only complaint is that the check-in time is 4pm and. after arriving on a 9 hour international flight first thing in the morning, waiting around all day before we could get into the rooms was a disappointment, although the hotel did provide safe storage for our luggage and helped to move and store it.

Great location for walking to many shopping opportunities, 2 blocks to Waikiki Beach, Walking distance to Waikiki Zoo & Waikiki Aquarium. Friendly front desk staff & maids Free wake-boards , . No parking on site. However they can get you connected with a guy who can rent you a private parking spot for $16 a day. TV and WiFi need updated

For a one night it was ok. Although I’m not going to stay there again or recommend it to anyone. Not the most comfortable nights sleep and the showers were really tight and awkward. Anything more than a night, I don’t think it’s worth the stay.

I should start this review by letting people know if they are looking for luxury this is not the hotel for you. However if you are looking for affordability, adequate accommodations and a convenient location than I definitely suggest looking in to the Kuhio Banyan Club. Below I have listed some helpful info and things that we came to find true at the KBC. We stayed in room 319- check in is at 4pm. We arrived early at about 11:00am and they had no rooms available yet however they did let us leave our bags and change so we could wander around Waikiki comfortably. Our room ended up being ready around 2:30pm-there is a $250 security deposit hold that they place on a credit card for incidentals but is released back to you after you check out and they have confirmed there is no damage to the room. - they also charge a $15 resort fee. This fee is non-negotiable. With this fee they have many things you can use such as beach towels, chairs, beach mats, umbrellas and more - the hotel has a washer and dryer you can use for $1.25 each-there is no parking here. They do however suggest places to park that are very nearby. - the rooms are dated and the photos on TripAdvisor are truly what you get. If this vibe is not for you then I do not recommend this hotel. - the kitchenette has a stove top, microwave, refrigerator and many dishes and utensils. It has NO stove. We used it a couple of times a day to save money- there is a grocery store located a block or so away which we found convenient. However if you travel further away from Waikiki you can get slightly better prices on most things -the Murphy bed is pretty firm but my husband and I enjoyed them for the most part. Sheets were clean and fresh. -there is a club practically right underneath the hotel. We found that especially over the weekend you could hear music from about 10pm-4am. It was not unbearable however. It was just a muffled sound. Some ear plugs would probably do the trick for any light sleepers. -bathroom was again dated but was exactly what I expected from pictures. Water pressure was amazing and the water got hot very quickly. - we only asked for housekeeping one day and all they did was take trash out and leave a roll of toilet paper. It would have been nice to come back to a freshly made bed but that didn't happen. - ice cream shop, subway,udon noodle place and many other small establishments are right downstairs. The new international marketplace is literally right across the street. - staff was pleasant. Never rude or hurried with us. - office is only open from 7:00am-10:00pm. If you check in late there is a $45 fee as someone must come from their home to check you in. They give you a key to come in as you would please late at night though. They do a good job on making people aware of this rule. - we had to leave the hotel at 4:00am for our flight we just let them know and they let us leave all of our keys and things in the hotel room. Overall we would stay here again we enjoyed our stay and it made our trip more affordable.

Just lost $651.00 from this place- I canceled after finding out about the fees. I had no idea that there was a $250.00 security deposit- on the payment confirmation, it just says security deposit-rip!

You couldnt ask for a more central spot in Waikiki. A walk through the International Marketplace and you are on the beach. The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious. At this time of year the air conditioner was very much appreciated. Downside- room decor: dated and tired and could do with a refurbishment. However being apartment rather than hotel rooms, it was very handy to have your own cooking facilities as the eateries in the area are not cheap and there is a supetmarket just one block away. I would definately stay again.

Best feature is its good location, but the rest is very basic. Some staff are great, while some are not friendly at all. My bed was quite uncomfortable and the common area staircases could do with some cleaning.

There are a lot of unexpected invisible fees. You have to pay 20 dollars a day to reserve a parking lot that 2 blocks away. You have to pay 45 dollars you want to check in after 10PM. You have to pay pay 12 dollars a day for beach towels... Most importantly, the customer service is too rude to believe! Don't book this hotel. Sleeping in the street will even better than it!

I arrived at KBC (note because this is considered a "resort" there is a $15 per night resort fee you must be aware of) to fine the front door locked. The security guard did not have a contact person to call to let me in. Very disheartening, I spent the next hour looking for a place to stay for the night. It set me back $250. The friendly staff stated it is in the policy that if you are arriving after 10 PM you must make arrangements. You can read it for yourself. I had never heard of such a thing but you better read it for yourself to make sure you are not disappointed and without a place to stay for the night. Let me just say, it feels like you are homeless. Another thing that one should know is although the air conditioner in the room worked (room was cool) it rattled and clanked the entire time. Maintenance staff was not able to fix it on my first night so the room was suffocating to say the least. This was a obvious problem but not dealt with until after the guest (me) had be check in. After 2 nights of difficulties I settled in. Staff was friendly but hotel/resort information on the website and 3rd party website MUST clearly showthe limitations of their registration/check in hours. I was very pleased with the location. It was across the street from the new International Marketplace and Nordstrom Rack (in case you forgot you shorts or swimsuit)

We had a lovely time being housed by lovely reception, house cleaners right through to General Manager whom we spoke to on several occasions.Property needs an overall make up.Tineshare resort that needs makeover.Would highly recommend for all, especially couples.Be entertained by the best hostess.

This hotel is one block from Waikiki Beach....great location with shops and restaurants right outside. Unfortunately there is no balcony but to be centrally located you don't really miss it. Transport is a 2 minute walk to go anywhere by bus at a cost of $2.50 one way. This hotel is not fancy but has everything you need including a kitchenette with everything provided. Wifi reception is sometimes not so good but if you cross the road and go into shopping complex it is great and free.

I was very worried about this hotel but was pleasantly surprised.The best feature is the perfect location. We were lucky as the carpet and furniture was new, the murphy bed was comfortable and was a great feature to be able to close it and give us extra space in the room! Kitchen was well stocked.The staff were helpful and the beach towels and umbrella came in handy.The safe did not work and staff could not do anything about it, the air condition was very loud so we turned it off when in room and put on the ceiling fan and lastly i needed earplugs because of the noise in the courtyard. But slept well regardless. Because of the high prices in Oahu, I think this was a good place for the location, spaciousness of room and it was clean.

You know I booked this place online. I returned to Honolulu/ Waikiki in Fall 2014 after being absent sine 1992. Waikiki has really developed much in the way of new high rises. A concrete and asphalt jungle. I will stay away in the future and explore other parts of Oahu. Maybe the other islands. Waikiki is just a human zoo of hackneyed tourist traps and shops. Basically BS.

there is a kitchen, a large bath and the pull out bed was super comfortable! no cross bars or anything! There was a couch and chair and window airconditioning that was sufficient for the room. It was an easy walk through the beautiful new Market Place to the beach etc. It was quiet too. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. I liked it!

A good place to stay as it is near the beach and across from the International Market Place with lots of eateries around. The Food Pantry supermarket is only a couple of blocks away. The bus stop is in front of the hotel and you can go to Moana Shopping Mall or to the Diamond Head easily by bus. The room is clean and has a kitchenette and a small fridge which comes in handy to store cold drinks. It has an elevator so you don't have to lug the luggage up and down the stairs. They also offer luggage storage if you check out early. The price is good and the staff are friendly and helpful.

We've been travelling for 5 months and needed somewhere to stay that had a kitchen so we booked here. We arrived at 10am and left our bags in storage as our room wasn't ready, we asked to be called asap when our room was ready. So with time to kill we headed to the beach which is a 10min walk away. We didn't get a call and came back at 2pm only to find our room wouldn't be ready till 4pm which is an outrage considering you have to check out at 10am, every other hotel normal check in is at 2pm. We also had to pay £12 a day for beach towels and rubber rings. This is a compulsory charge even if you DONT USE THE ITEMS. Two ladies stayed for 10 days and had to pay £120 for the use of towels! Which is an absolute joke. We used the items when we went to the beach as we were paying for them, when getting the towels from reception the staff are rude and it feels like you are putting them out if there way.The room it's self is very dated, the pillows are like sleeping on a bag of tennis balls. there is a club outside the hotel which is open till 4am and gets VERY LOUD on a weekend!!! The staff are rude, when I complained about not being able to check in till 4pm that just said it's hotel policy.And another joke is they give you 2 coffees in your room on arrival if you run out you have to buy more.Overall the hotel has been far most money grabbing hotel I've ever been to, hidden charges everywhere. £76 a night is not justified in what you pay and the service you get. I wish I had read the reviews before hand.

We stayed here for 2 weeks and as a lot of the other reviews say it is easy on the pocket and a good central location with good access to the highway and also buses around the island. When we arrived we were told if we lost the key we'd have to call the staff to get us back in which would cost $45 (I think) there is also a charge of around $20 a day which you pay when you leave.The rooms are average, there's a fold out bed, a small kitchenette, a safe, a TV, AC (ours was quiet) and enough room to keep your belongs. There are a few WiFi networks but they have very poor signal and I am glad we didn't have to pay for it.Other than that the staff were decent, one of the female receptionists was very rude but the others were nice.

Very good location with good price (just opposit of international market place)! Friendly and helpful staff, especially the young guys are very kind, the room was clean and tidy though it is old. The air conditioner may need to be updated. (It was very noisy so we have to turn it off). Would definitely recommend to other travellers.

In the heart of Waikiki we couldn't of asked for a better place to stay on a low budget. With all the other bad reviews, I'd say go pay double the price if you want to hang out in your room all day. But that's not why we were in Waikiki. So much to do and this hotel was walking distance to everything. It had a kitchenette with all the utensils one would need to keep costs down. We bought breakfast stuff from Wal Mart which was a short bus ride away. Staff were friendly and always willing to answer any questions. If you have a late flight arriving past 10:00 pm let them know. If they have to come back to let you in, you could get charged 45 bucks so be aware. Late flight leaving? We were able to leave our luggage safely in a locked room for the day until pick up since check out was 10:00 AM. Yes there is bar underneath hotel and can get quite noisy in the courtyard. We were able to ask for a room further away from the bar. If you can't there's ear plugs!

Looking for easy on the pocket accommodation in the middle if Waikiki? Stay here. The unit although you have to pull down your bed from a cupboard is comfortable and has kitchenette facilities to help with cost. Fantastic location and a good place to rest your head ... let's be honest, you don't go to Waikiki to hang out in your hotel room right?! I would definitely stay again.

This place actually borders on being a "dump", but the location is good. There's no parking, no real amenities and house keeping is inconsistent. If you don't care for looks, and don't mind the smell, then this place is great for putting you right at the center of all the fun.

If you are traveling on a small budget, this hotel is decent for its value. It is much cheaper than most of the hotels in the area. The location in Waikiki is not bad, walking distance to restaurants and shops. Too far to walk to the beach. Our first issue was parking....there is only first-come-first-serve street parking or nearby parking lots/garages for ~$20+. The first time we tried to find parking to check into the hotel, it took so long that the driver just had to circle until I finished checking in and we ran out of time before our dinner reservation. The other times, we found free parking with about a ~ 3-4 block walk to the hotel. Front desk hours are only from 7am-10pm; they don't take check-ins between 10pm and 7am so keep that in mind. At check-in, they provided me with the remote, hairdryer, iron, two sets of two keys, and a stern warning about the fees incurred if any are lost. All those items in addition to my luggage, I left with very full hands. The first time I went into the room I was very unimpressed, vowed to never stay there again. Everything in the room is outdated, the mini window A/C unit rattles and the bed is a Murphy bed. However by the end of the trip, I was satisfied for the price. Pros: The mattress was very comfortable, the water in the shower gets very hot, A/C works, and there are roll away couches in the room that could sleep 2 additional ppl. The front desk offers lots of free beach equipment, and there is a bus/trolley station ride outside the front door to the lobby.Cons: There are no toiletries in the bathroom, checkout is at 10am, there is a $15/day resort fee, and there is a nightclub basically under the hotel which keeps guests awake. No parking, and A/C unit made noise (helped drown out the noise from the nightclub).

Busy Location off of Kuhio Ave,Hotel in center of Waikiki area. Very close to shopping and lots of other points of interest.Parking is not very good though. Very very difficult to find parking nearby.The hotel has absolutely no parking at all.Kuhio Banyon hotel rooms have difficult time getting very hot water at all. Must run water for at least 10-20 minutes to even get luke warm water. Horrible.

My second time at Kuhio Banyan Club and I will stay here again on my next trip. It is a very low key facility, maybe a throwback to late 50s/60s, but then, so am I. It is inexpensive so don't compare it to the big hotels. No great sweeping ocean views, no great restaurants, pool or valet parking - actually no parking! But it is clean, safe and 5 minutes walk to the beach; or 60 minutes if you stop and shop and gawk!It's on busy Kuhio Avenue and has a friendly staff. The rooms offer fridge, microwave, all utensils, free Wi-Fi, TV and stereo. The bed is pull down (Murphy?) and all in all, a great deal for single, couples or small families. Apply your savings to touring and enjoying beach activities.The Kuhio Banyan is minutes from everything and 30 seconds from the door is the Marukame Udon Restaurant! Tour buses and TheBus stop outside.

First of all, if your are looking for a Marriott then this is not the place to go. This was my first time in Honolulu and had no problems whatsoever. Location is perfect! The club downstairs did not bother us, we were located opposite side of the club. Checking in was a smooth process. Thank you Jessie and Paul! Everything was explained properly and were very helpful. We had two rooms which were adjoining rooms (205 & 206) was very convenient. Rooms were clean and the Murphy bed was really comfortable. Even the couches! I would totally stay here again cause the price was awesome!! Housekeeping and security was so friendly!! Downfall...no parking but they were helpful in suggesting a place to park! Thanks Kuhio Banyon!

Me and my husband were very underwhelmed! The shower took a long time to run hot water, the room was very dated, poor ventilation in the room. It took a whole day for the air conditioner to work. We left two days into our stay. Look elsewhere.

Do Not book this Hotel. Ever. Be advised this hotel are thieves. Do not book with them ever. Do not use Booking.com. Pay a little more for a better hotel. Please take my advice. Please do not book here. Please do not book here.

Super, clean and fabulous location! We were able to catch the bus from outside to Pearl Harbor which cost $2.50 each way! Also we have found out that we can get the bus 19 or 20 to the airport again $2.50 bargain. The front desk guy was very friendly and efficient. We had a studio with a kitchenette, bathroom and shower for a two night stay, perfect.

Second visit to Kuhio Banyan in Waikiki. There is evidence of some upgrades in the 16 months since my last visit. The Banyan is an old school studio style with Murphy beds, a small but full kitchenette, and living area. The television is much better, large screen wall mounted. But the carpets the same throughout. Some walls have been painted (or cleaned) but towels and linens are old and thin. The hotel is located directly across Kuhio from the brand new international market, and within a few easy blocks of Waikiki beach. The walking score should be high. There are a number of small markets and high end retail stores. The trolley and basically stop right outside. I am a happy return customer.
