review_body: Room was very old and dated. Hot water was terrible had to run it 5 min before it became warm. Staff were very helpful and went out of their way to help. Very good location . Night club under room so if you are a light sleeper Foret it . I would not stay here again.

Stay anywhere else. Lots of nickle and dime costs, they really rip you off here. We stayed at several other hotels that were heaps nicer in the same price range. This place is located in a decaying building that is a fire hazard. Saw a drug deal take place right out front. Staff were EXTREMELY rude and unhelpful. The room itself was aweful. The fold down bed was hard as a rock. The shower has about 10 mins of luke warm water. The wifi is so bad it's unusable. There is constant noise from the main road outside. Stay anywhere else!

Being from Australia we did not know what a resort fee was after paying $18 a night for "resort" fees we got nothing for this except towel hire. There is no pool, minimal house keeping and you have to put a $250 holding on the first day which needs to be on a credit card not a travel money card. The bed is comfortable but is a fold out from the cupboard. It is a good location and it does have the perk of having a full functioning kitchen if you wanted to keep costs down. Definitely not worth the money when you add up all the extra expenses, having to pay for parking in streets nearby it is not as cheap as it seems. We would rather pay a few extra dollars and avoid the hassle of hidden costs and no parking. There is also a night club right below the building so if you end up on the wrong side of the "resort" you will hear it. The staff were friendly however and just doing their job.

The room was simple and nice enough. You pull the bed down from the wall, after which there's pretty much no space to move around the living room, but it's workable. You're right next to a club but the windows are thick so this actually wasn't a disturbance. The big bummer is that the windows don't open, so you're stuck suffocating with air conditioning 24-7. The room comes replete with a whole bunch of kitchen stuff, nice if you want to prep simple meals. The bathroom was simple enough. The only thing that surprised me was, staying there for 10 nights for a long international conference, the room service was irregular. I hung the tag for service the second day and never got the tag back, so had to ask the desk for service if I wanted it, or got it unexpectedly. Staff were nice enough, didn't have much interaction with them. You have keys to get in after hours. Centrally located. Don't confuse this for a typical hotel, it's more like a quasi-homestay without the family. Internet was super-spotty no matter where in the room or which one of the multiple frequencies they had, totally makes you question the cost of the hotel if they can't even provide this basic amenity, which is why I've marked the entry as "no wifi" - it wasn't functional. Unfortunately you don't get much for your money anywhere in Waikiki, unless you want to shell out double what you'd pay on the mainland (welcome to Hawai'i, no surprise).

I was worried after reading all the negative reviews, but was pleasantly satisfied! The room was clean and safe that all that matters. The walls are a bit thin, the last night I was waken by people having sex argggg had to turn on the AC to drown the noise. But besides that the service of the front staff was very accommodating and warm. I am not sure if I would stay there again unless the walls were updated...but you can't beat the location, so central! If you are worried about the noise of the club, I called earlier to request a room away from the club!

Kuhio Banyan is an older establishment in a very prime location. KBC is both a hotel and a timeshare. In the timeshare studios, there is a fully equipped kitchen, including a small coffee pot, small refrigerator, two burners, sink, and a microwave in the kitchen area. I'm not sure if all rooms have the same things. There is a Murphy bed, two couches, a small table with two chairs. There is an AC in the unit, conveniently set to 74 when I arrived. For those who have been to Waikiki before, the International Market Place across the street is gone. The marketplace has been replaced with shopping; Saks Fifth Avenue. There is convenient shopping for supplies two blocks away, towards Diamond Head. Also, ask the front desk to see if they have beach chairs, towels, etc. to use at the beach. There is no parking, none! But don't worry, Waikiki is a walking town. Or, catch The Bus, the office has a listing of which bus to take to many locations across the island. TIP: The Bus really doesn't allow luggage onboard.

I guess you get what you pay for. The room was under $100 a night but parking was a nightmare. I ended up paying $30-$40 a day for parking at 2 different lots. The hotel location is in the middle of Waikiki so you have alot of shopping and restaurants to choose from. The beach is walking distance, about 10 minutes.

Overall good value for money with a good location in Waikiki - not too far from the beach, shops and restaurants.The customer service was good with the staff very helpful, even managing to check us in at 7am after a very early flight arrival time (luckily they had someone check out very early!). The room itself was clean and good to have the ability to make food. The pots though could be replaced - there were a lot of burn marks on the bottom of the pots and were really at the end of their lives. Although the Murphy bed meant we had more space, it was quite hard to move up and down. It was unfortunate that the windows couldn't be opened but there was air conditioning to cool the room down. The shower wasn't great - I realised after a couple of rather cold showers that it took a few good minutes of letting the water before it got anywhere near warm. Maybe because we were at the very end of a row of rooms the hot water took a while to get to us?!The reception isn't open 24hrs a day so make sure you are checking in within the office hours. Wireless internet was available and worked well.Note you will have a deposit taken from your credit card of $250 (I think) which will be returned after they make sure all items in the room are accounted for. There was plenty of room for two people with two lounges to sit on, and a dining table and kitchen bench. Overall if you're looking for a central location and a place to sleep (not luxuriate in) which is cheaper than most other places then this is good value for money.Also there's a great, cheap udon noodle place out the front which always has a line but it moves really fast.

If you're not looking for a very fancy place just a good time Kuhio banyan hotel is perfect! The staff was great the room was clean they provide us with more than enough from dishes to beach chairs. If you know you're not staying in a Hilton don't bash it like it is a Hilton. My boyfriend and I are 22 so we couldn't afford much but because we stayed here we were able to have a great time! Just follow their policies and you won't have any issues! Thanks again Kuhio banyan hotel!

We hesitated booking this hotel for our 3 weeks stay in Waikiki due to the negative reviews but it met our expectations. It is reasonably well priced in the heart of Waikiki, close to the beach, right next to the most popular japanese restaurant Marukame, Saks on fifth avenue is across the road and so is Ross. The studio we got was away from the night club, they considered that we have an infant with us. Yes, you pay for a $15 resort fee per day which I don't understand either, but we were still winning in value in comparison to the prices of the other hotels around the area. My only complaint is that there was no kettle, besides that the room was kept clean, the bed was clean and comfortable. We loved the idea of the pull out bed as it gave us so much room and our crawling baby loved it too. Finding this hotel gave us financial flexibility to spend more on activities and shopping.

They are extremely dishonest.We had clearly stated that we would arrive within an hour after the opening time, we arrived as announced, but there was none.We called for a while ', a vigilante patrolling the area also, but nothing.Moral of the story:- Our first night of their honeymoon, after 24 hours of flight, we went to look for a room in another hotel which we then paid 200 $ ...- They would not refund the first night as requested because according to them had to make a promise to the late arrival as specific as you write it "only" in booking- They charged us $ 15 city tax when we had already paid in the other hotels (though they offered you to pay it by sending a check in the mail ...)- It turns out that if you remained like closed off, with $ 45 if you called would come, however, unfortunate that when we called us did not show anyone.- Good positionSo bad, not recommended.

My husband and I stayed here for 10 days in July 2016. I was concerned about all the bad reviews but it was the cheapest place in all of Waikiki so I couldn't pass it up. I prefer to spend my money on eating out, doing fun activities, and shopping, rather than on a fancy hotel. We paid CAD$980 for the 10 days which is ridiculously cheap for vacationing in Hawaii. The hotel is on the old side, but then again, so is everything else in Honolulu. I found that it exceeded my travel needs. The reception desk staff are very nice, polite, and helpful. The murphy bed was surprisingly very comfortable (although the pillows we a bit lumpy). While there is a club right below the hotel, I never heard any noise from there (we were on the fourth floor). The hotel room has everything you need including a kitchenette with pots, plates, cutlery, microwave, mini fridge, and lots more. And the location is perfect for getting around Waikiki and going to the beach. The wifi was decent as I was able to download stuff to watch at night :-)The one downside is that the hotel has no parking. We were lucky enough to always find a parking spot in the parking lot on Nohonani Street (across White Sands Hotel) where parking is the cheapest I've seen in Waikiki. It was $12 for 12 hours and $18 for 24 hours. If you are arriving after 10pm, call the hotel in advance and they will provide you a passcode for the safe where you can pick up your keys. There's always a security guard there to help.

HIDDEN FEES!! $ 15.00 a day extra just to stay there! I have never had to leave a deposit of $250.00, yes $250.00 just in case anything is missing!! Sign for the remote control for a t.v. That is from the 80's!! No made service !! Twice a week you get clean towels, seriously! Rusted out bathroom closet doors and ants on the walls and basin, old jealousy Windows! Someone knocked at our door at 11:00pm, howling pipes! Oh and you have to wait for your deposit, till they go thru there inventory. No regular beds all Murphy beds, no view and our room had a distinct SMELL!!! I want my $$ back! Expedia should be affiliated with this place!! NEVER AGAIN!

After reading all of the reviews, I took a chance and booked on Hotwire and got the Kuhio Banyan Hotel. At first, I was really scared because some of the reviews were not that kind. However, I do think that the room is totally fine. It's not the biggest room with the Murphy bed pull down, but it has everything one could want for a solo or couple traveling to Oahu. The room is clean, the sofa is actually very comfortable. The shower could be a little bit cleaner but I've had to shower at 24 Hour Fitness which is a million times worst. And with basic kitchen stove, sink and refrigerator, one can save a ton on money if you decided to cook your own meals in pricey Waikiki. TV is small but I'm not in Hawaii for the TV and neither should you be! If you want fancy, this is not your place, but for basic accommodation for a great price, I wouldn't hesitate in booking here again as long as the room was away from the "Playbar" on the ground level which as a lot of noise.

First, you better know that this place is not cheap for nothing, you cannot check in later that 10 pm or you'll need to call a number and they will charge you 45 USD to check you in. If you have a late flight, good luck! Also, you have to carry a real key to acces the building (plus your room card) and if you lose that key or lock yourself out when the reception is closed, you'll have to pay 45USD for someone to come in and let you in. The beds are ok, nothing wrong there. The room are quite small and outdated. Not enought light and a lil musty smell (from the carpets I guess). The room was clean. You don't go to hawaii to spend too much time inside the room but there might be better alternatives...The staff were polite and friendly and the resort's fees are 15 USD/day.

only good thing about this was the hotel was located on the hop on hop off bus route the in room Wi Fi never worked, rooms old, bed pull down out of cupboard, linen was however clean and plenty of clean bath towels..noise from people talking on verandahs and smoking in non smoking areas...no help with luggage, noisy night club under hotel.

They are specialist in destroyed your vacation. The built is dirt. The room dirty too, the bed is like a camping. The internet wiffi is too poor. The front desk was the worst in the world. Keep out if you intend to stay in a safe place. Very dangerous people work in this hotel!!!

Stayed here for a week in April. I had some reservations about staying here (semi pun semi intended), having read several very negative reviews. However, the package that included the Kuhio Banyan was by far the least expensive I'd found, so I gambled--and won. The studio in which I stayed was almost exactly as described/pictured in the promotional literature (furniture upholstery was a drab solid color rather than the bright floral print shown in the brochure). Stove top needed a minor repair, but the cheerful maintenance man got right on the job and it was serviceable in minutes. All staff with whom I came in contact were courteous. The required security deposit was explained very clearly upon check in--it had also been stated clearly in the booking information. The security deposit was credited back to my account within a few hours after checkout. I believe my room was cleaned three times during my stay, which is one more time than I anticipated. The location was fairly good. There is a nightclub very near the hotel, but I was never bothered by noise from it. I have no complaints, and if the price is right, I will return.

We booked this hotel in a package through Hawaiian Airlines and were very disappointed. We have stayed in Waikiki many times and this is the first time we were unhappy. We looked in the room, it was very old but clean. Everything was very old and I couldn't see me eating or drinking from the crockery. Our room was above the night club and the air cons for the club were straight outside our door. The Windows didn't open and there was no sunlight. I guess we would have been there for about 1 hour and we checked out. We did not get any money back and was charged $15.00 resort fee even though we didn't touch a thing. This was the first time I have booked this way and I would not do it again. We walked down the street and stayed in a hotel straight across for the beach.

Kuhio Banyan was perfect for our trip! Very centrally located, we didn't need a car for the trip, most excursions pick up a block away and there is high-end shopping and grocery a few blocks away. The efficiency condos have everything you need to prepare a meal at home, and if you are missing anything the staff goes out of their way to make you stay enjoyable. Our room was very clean and the murphy bed was surprisingly comfortable! I would stay here again. Of note, there is a club on the ground floor, we had requested a room away from that location prior to check in and the outside noise was minimal. Great stay!

Booked a room. Connecting Flight was late. I called them before 10pm as per policy to let them know of the situation. They said it wouldn't be a problem and to just ask security to call a staff member when I get there. I get to honolulu and pay a cab $40 to get there or more and the security calls the front desk staff who doesn't answer. I'm stranded! Nothing they can do! Security tries phoning them again -nothing. And almost all hotels are booked. I called for 30min to find one. They don't answer. I call for a refund several times only to be told by the manager that I was harassing them and they wouldn't refund it. I call expedia and they call the hotel and expedia refunds my money. I had booked a second booking for my flight back at the same time as this orig booking and they wouldn't cancel this either as an exception. They said I made a mistake by booking it. Avoid this place at all costs! F---- If I could give zero stars I would!

Stayed there 2/23-3/1 First let me say that the hotel is basically what everyone else says. It was clean, and housekeeping came in each day. We were on the 4th floor and heard no noise from the supposedly horrible night club. There were no hookers or anything that looked scary. The staff were all equally helpful, and friendly. There were some tiny ants that would hang around the sink in the kitchen area. But not enough to bother your food or items placed on the counter. The bed, and couches were ok not lumpy or falling apart. It is best described as a motel than hotel. It did have nice towels chairs and other beach amenities to use. The wifi worked well in our room also. We chose this room because we were interested in seeing the island not hanging in the room. There is no smoking anywhere other than out front of the building. This is also a non smoking area but must be a unwritten rule because that's where we all smoked. Pain in the butt but tollarable, and keeps the room smelling clean Overall I would stay again due to a budget and location. The bus and trollys stop right out front and take you almost anywhere you want to go. Tour pick ups are also easy to arrange as well. Thank you for a great first trip to Hawaii Kuhio Banyan Club

review_body: this hotel is in need of a remodel ,booked as a package with hawaiian air , flight was fine, but we could not check in till 4 pm ,the clerk we had was very good but most of clerks for the rest of the week were jerks . to our surprise we got a murphy bed . the location was exlnt. 1block from the beach and across the street from the old international market place which is now gone and a large building is under construction . we flew out of san jose ,ca do not take s and e bay shuttle as never show up at the airport to take us home even with a prepaid voucher.

Having read the reviews, we truly feel that Kuhio Banyan Club has been given a bum rap.Yes, it is beside a strip club. We heard nothing. Gentle hum of well-functioning air conditioner let us sleep peacefully through the night.Yes, it is worn. The carpets and cupboards need changing/upgrading. But it was clean and properly equipped.The large bathroom was a great bonus.The furniture was excellent and appropriate.Yes, it has a Murphy (pull-down) bed. This was wonderful! Each morning, we flipped the bed into the cupboard and had a very spacious room for the entire day! And it was a comfortable Queen bed.The staff were awesome! Suggested different things. Provided us with beach towels and equipment.And yes, they offered to store our luggage not only when we were checking out, but when we were early for checking in.If you're checking in late, phone ahead instead of complaining later about no one being there.The security is amazing. Always a constant presence, roaming the area and halls, and checking doorways."Awesome" accommodation? No"Great" accommodation? NoReasonable accommodation at a reasonable exchange rate in the heart of Waikiki? YES! We would stay again.

If you show up expecting a Turtle Bay Resort-like experience, you will be disappointed. If you want a bed, roof over your head, and a place to take a shower, then you'll be fine. This is the Motel 6 of Waikiki. Yes, the room is small, the decor is dated, and my laptop has a larger screen than the tv. I was only in the room to sleep, the room was clean, and I didn't go to Hawaii to watch tv.The bed was a Murphy bed. If you don't know what that is, it means the bed folds up into a wall cabinet. Suprisingly the bed was comfortable which is important since my back tends to hurt after sleeping on most beds.Kuhio Banyan Club is about a two block or 8-minute walk to the beach and luxury shopping. There were three good restaurants right outside the front door; an udon noodle place, a taco place, and a Korean bbq joint.The front desk has a limited number of beach chairs and other beach items for check out. The vast majority of the front desk staff was very nice, except for one woman who was constantly rude and dismissive.There is a club on the ground floor. We were there Saturday night through the next Saturday morning. The music only bothered us the first night but we arrived late that night when things were in full swing and we were tired from a full day of traveling. If you think it will be an issue, ask for a room on the other side of the hotel from the club.My one major complaint was that wifi did not work while we were there. We had to use data to examine maps, to confirm and check reservations, and look up restaurants and other points of interest. We do not have a large data plan.Overall, the Kuhio Banyan Club met our needs.

I booked and paid in advance for this place and arrived 15 minutes after their 10pm closing time. I had to then pay US$180 to get a room across the road as it was the night before the Honolulu marathon. Their response was you paid and where late and we close at 10 pm. They don't have a after hours number and are just arrogant and rude. It's cheap and I wasn't expecting a lot but nothing can prepare you for this. Their response to booking.com who also raised my complaint with them was ...This is also a Non-Refundable reservation and we will not be issuing a refund for this reservation. Have a good day.So if there is any possibility you could be delayed I strong suggest that you stay at a real hotel.

Staying at the Kuhio Banyan is not for those who expect a lot. It is a little bit off of Waikiki beach, but an easy two block walk. The price is a little bit affordable, compared to the big name resorts. Each room has a little bitty refrigerator and television. But who goes to Hawaii to watch tv? The location is central to both high- end and low -end shopping, food, and activities. A lovely mix of tourist (hawkers, time share pitches, rip off, pricey, pushy) and locals (drunks, music, fights, cops, homeless). Take the local bus to any event rather than a tour ($2.50) and enjoy the sights on your own time and you will fit right in. Hawaiians are a beautiful and friendly people. The more you engage with the locals the better your experience will be.

review_body: Small room in a great location. Some noise from the nightclub downstairs, 1 night out of 3 needed ear plugs to sleep. The room was immaculate, considering the age of the place. Very old decor but surprisingly well maintained. For the price I thought it excellent value for money and much better than expected for a 2-star place. I will definitely stay again when I'm transiting through Honolulu.

We had a room booked at the Kuhio Banyan for a week. After 3 horrible days, we have check out. The rooms are horrible. Murphy bed, dark, gross, gross, gross. The place is so noisy. Night club underneath so yelling etc until 330am. The staff at the front desk are completely miserable. Not one of them smiles or gives a care. We were charged a mandatory 15.00 per day whether or not we used beach chairs, towels etc. Did not feel safe there. We talked many couples staying there...comments were if they had known what a disgusting place this was, they would have never stayed. No balconies or anywhere to sit outside and relax.

The check in/out process was slow and really redundant.Now to review this place, where to start, the office is a whole in the wall, if you don't pay attention you would miss the door type of place. It is an older 4 story building that has a bunch of shops on the first floor one of which is a night club. The elevator is small max capacity is 7 people, or two adults with two rolling luggage cases. Now the room I had 301 wasn't that bad, of course it had a Murphy bed, two burner stove, closet in the bathroom, step up shower, and a 19" tv these seem to be the norm for everyone. Our room was missing the clock. I had asked to print out some trip vouchers and boarding passes, this didn't seem to be an issue except they don't let you have any access to a printer, so you have to email it to them then they will print it for you. This isn't really a problem except for the fact that I was given the wrong email address and then the woman behind the counter just seemed to be more interested in eating then helping any customers. Seriously I had several face to face dealings with her and every time she was eating, she closed the office for quite a bit of time to eat.This place is in need of some updates, things like the bed are quaint which I like but the customer amenities need to be upgraded. They could take an open store front and create a work out space and a business center. The property doesn't offer a pool, and doesn't seem to be any space to add one.

This is my 3rd review of the banyan. It consistently gets bad ratings from other travelers and to an extent I can see why. However this time I am happy to report that some money has been spent on this bldg. and the rooms. Even the old small elevator has been remodeled. Maybe RCI got on them, I don't know but it is an improvement. Our room #201 was clean and smelled fresh upon our arrival. All the bed linen was clean. New furniture had been added to the room since our last stay( Sept2013 ). Yes there is still an old 19" t v in the room along with a Murphy bed ,mini fridge and stove top which has 2 burners. The small air conditioner keeps the room clean and there is a pedestal fan in the closet if you need it. The bathroom was clean and very adequate. The staff was nothing but nice. I can not say enough good things about them. This timeshare/hotel will be across the street from the new International Market Place when it opens. It is close to everything. They have a security guard at night . It is about a 10-15 min walk to Waikiki Beach. Will stay there again

All of the staff members were very helpful with room assistants, and locating local businesses per our requests. They even explained the trolley and bus system and give us printed information. This place is older and there are bars near by thankfully only Saturday night was noisy. Due to a previous injury I did have my husband assist me getting out the shower as there were no support bars for people who need this assistance.

Never been so livid in my life! Before you book this place, be warned (because the hotel website has a well-hidden, sneaky clause way down in the website where you would never think to look, even after reviewing it having been left homeless on your first nights pre-booked accommodation) that the reception closes at 10pm...the website does NOT make this clear, nor does it make it clear that this means that if you arrive after 10pm on your first night, there is NOBODY who can check you in, and tough luck, you will just have to wander the streets of Waikiki until you find another hotel with an available room with a last-minute rip-off price, on top of loosing the money you paid for your room at Kuhio Banyan Club. Oh, and in the morning, when you arrive to check in on your second day, the reception staff will have absolutely no sympathy, but will be very quick to point out the part of the website that has this hidden clause - suspiciously like this has happened many times before, but nothing has been done to fix it - and why would they - paid room for the night with no need to clean it the next morning because we didn't stay!To make the whole thing worse, the following night, we witnessed a family with two young children sitting exactly where we sat the night before, looking totally bereft because obviously the same thing had happened to them. A recurring money-making racket. A simple fix would be to make this condition very obvious and clear on the website - it's not that difficult! Or train the security guard to check guests in after 10pm, if they don't want to pay extra for a receptionist to stay! Incidentally, if you get locked out after 10pm, they charge $45 for someone to come let you in, and even then, they may not bother to answer the phone, so make sure you get locked out with a credit card or be prepared to sleep on the street!When we checked in on our second day, that evening we were asked to move to another room because they needed to do maintenance on the room they had given us a few hours before - total lack of organisation. And to top it all off, the new room couldn't pick up the wifi! Never again.

My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and was pleasantly surprised after reading such terrible reviews. My reply to those awful reviews would be.. You get what you pay for! This hotel was by far the cheapest we could find in the Waikiki area and we were impressed with what we got for our money.. The location is fantastic.. Right in the heart of Waikiki with shops, restaurants, and of course the breath taking Waikiki beach all within a 5 minute walk. The young man on the front desk was very polite and helpful.. The other lady on the desk not so much, she often looked miserable and didn't help us out so much. The amenities were very good.. The kitchenette and all of the appliances were put to good use.. The room was serviced 3 times during our stay. The pull down bed was uncomfortable but bearable as I'm not fussy. Security was good, I felt safe as everything is locked up after 10pm and only accessible with a key. The night club below the hotel as well as the AC unit are both very noisy so earplugs are a must if you wish to get any sleep. Overall we had a very pleasant stay at a very affordable price.. If you want a luxurious plush hotel to stay in then go and pay thousands elsewhere otherwise if you would just like a basic room to lay your head and are not particularly fussy where you stay then I highly recommend this hotel. *WARNING* if you need to check in after 10pm please email them and inform them as they will charge you an extra $45 call out fee and sometimes as I found with a French couple who tried to check in at 10.30pm, no one will come out at all to let you in meaning you will have to stay elsewhere that evening!!

ALOHA! First time in Hawaii for me! Everything around was Amazing! The hotel location allows to access to Waikiki beach, restaurants and shopping stores within walking distance so I chose to ignore the small room with blocked windows. Inside the room there was also a pretty well-equipped kitchen, which we didn't used it anyway. The cleanliness was at a very basic level. Elegantly speaking was enough place for improvement. .BTW for us the biggest minus wasn't the noise that it could be heard from the neighbors but the lack of parking!

I am so livid I don't even want to give it a 1 out of 5. Is there a negative 5? I booked this hotel at the last minute for my three young adult children to stay for the night in Waikiki as an exciting adventure away from our boring seaside cottage in Kaaawa and their boring parents. The last-minute rate was great at $75. After we arrived and asked for possible early check-in or at the very least a place the kids could stow their backpacks, we were flatly refused. The seemingly haole-hating staff asked how many in our party. I said we booked double occupancy and was there an extra person room fee, and they said I'd have to book another room for my third kid. Has that EVER happened? I didn't ask for an extra bed. I've brought my kids all over the world--they've slept in bathtubs for crying out loud. I wasn't going to rent another room with these rigid, not very friendly people, and I certainly wasn't going to ask my kids to draw straws to see who could stay. THEY WOULD NOT ALLOW THREE PEOPLE IN THE ROOM OR GIVE US A BIGGER ONE, even for a fee. So I attempted to cancel the reservation. HAHAHAHAHAHA! Basically, it was, your screwed, and we're taking your money. Not a chance in hell would they work with us. No budging. I hope the 75 bucks and the satisfaction they derived from being jerks to a normal, middle aged mom trying to do something nice for her kids sustains them when their business falls down around their ears, even as their smug expressions remain etched in their koa wood faces. Judging by the other reviews here, it won't be long.

Its location is perfect which allows to access to Waikiki beach, restaurants and shopping stores within walking distance. Also the room is compact, but is very comfortable with sofa, kitchenette, dinning table, free Wi-fi and others.

Waikiki sure could use some budget hotel alternatives to the top dollar big name resort hotels. The Kuhio Banyan could be a decent one if only they actually had some customer service.The location is fine, in the heart of Waikiki a short walk away from the beach and most places, with buses running nearby the further away destinations. The rooms are dated and worn, but functional and the kitchenette is okay for cooking simple meals. Unlike the previous reviewer I actually found the fold-out bed to be quite okay and a neat idea to save space in the room during the day. The room rate at under $90 per night was okay too for Waikiki in July. There's no wifi, but at least my room got a public wifi signal from the street thru the window so that was fine.That's the good parts. Unfortunately the bad parts completely wreck the experience. First of all the reception closes at 10 PM sharp. My flight got in at 10:30 and I was at the hotel an hour later. There was a security guard who advised me that he can call someone to check me in for an additional $45 fee. Well, it's not like I have a choice.The woman who appeared hardly spoke any English apart from informing me that the $45 would be accepted in cash only. Funnily the room charge and the "security deposit" ($250) could be paid with a credit card just fine. So that was another $2.75 charge to withdraw the cash from their on-site ATM (no doubt part of it making it into the hotel's accounts). I know why they do this - to avoid people disputing this dubious charge - but yeah, fair it isn't.Oh and check out time is at 10 AM. Since I had a shuttle pick up scheduled for 11 I asked for them to store my bag until then. "Sir, our hotel policy is not to store any customer bags." Yeah right? That's the most ridiculous hotel policy I've ever heard of! Only stay at this place if you are a misanthrope and prefer the company of others like you. They don't care about their customers - all they see you as is a walking roll of dollars.Worst hotel I've stayed in for the last three years or so.

Do not stay here. The bed folds out of the wall and is extremely uncomfortable. My partner and I have both got bad backs from sleeping on it. The room was only serviced once in a week and all they did was change the towels didn't replace the toilet paper or empty the bins. The staff are hit and miss some are helpful and others just seem hopeless. The tv is ancient. There's no fresh air as the windows don't open. The step into the shower is missing plaster and is rotting. The cupboard for clothes is in the bathroom. The toilets clog easily so they leave a plunger next to it. The only good thing about this place is it's location. It's close to the beach, shops and restaurants.

You get what you pay for with this hotel. The check in and check out process was slow. The bed is a Murphy bed. Other family member's mattresses were OK, but ours felt like a sofa bed. On a good note, the had towels, booggie boards, umbrellas, and chairs for the beach - which was only a short walk away. There was also a lot of shipping close by, and most shuttles stopped within a block.

I unfortunately did not have the privilege to stay in this hotel (but from the reviews I read, maybe I was lucky) because I arrived after the 10pm "check in by this time or else" time. There was no pre-warning from either Orbitz or the hotel of this check-in condition (Orbitz have since updated the description on their page of the hotel description, however this was not implied when I booked). Essentially, I have spent well over 4 hours and 6 different phone calls (both on the night of the incident, and after my holiday finished) requesting that I be refunded for the new hotel I had to book. They started with apologising and saying "we're sorry there's nothing we can do" and then after requesting a supervisor become involved, a $30 voucher was offered and they said "it's the most we can do for you." I kept arguing that I was out of pocket $150 (the cost of the new hotel I had to book at midnight that night) so they need to refund me this. They then upped the voucher to $50, and again "it's the best we can do." More arguing, and then they offered a $60 voucher and "this is the absolute best we can do for you." Orbitz have washed their hands of this entire situation, provided me no support (both on the night and following up on my holiday with their service) and have just lost a customer. On the night of the incident, after being on the phone to them for ~2 hours, they told me there was "nothing they could do, you'll have to go check yourself into a new hotel out of your own pocket and we'll sort it out later." Needless to say, the service from Orbitz was abysmal, and I'll never be using them again. On a separate but similar note, I ended up staying at Aqua Waikiki Wave Hotel which was across the road about 150m away. It was slightly more expensive, but more away from the noisy area, very clean, great service. I would definitely recommend this one.

So this is my second time staying at Kuhio Banyon and my second review of it. This is by far one of the most reasonable places to stay in Waikiki and though it is not luxurious, it serves its purpose. The rooms are modest, but has all the essentials. The bonus of the whole thing is that it has a kitchenette which makes it really convenient to cook your own food and not have to eat out all the time. My advice for anyone trying to really go Hawaii on a budget is to bring some of your own food from home and buy the necessities when you get here. I brought: cereal (granola-sturdy to hold up while traveling) elbow macaroni (although it was only about 1.29 for a bag at Foodland) peanut butter (Jif to-go), tuna packs (not cans), tortillas, etc. Pretty much anything that was easy to carry and wouldn't break too much during travel. The extra bonus was at the end of my trip I had all that room in my bag to put all my souvenirs! Foodland is 2 small blocks away from the room so it was easy to get staples: milk, spaghetti sauce, mayo, bagels, etc. The bus stop for most buses is right outside the lobby door and you can go to Costco, Sam's, or Walmart for even more savings.I found the front staff to be not as friendly or as helpful this time which was surprising. They were still friendly enough, but it was more out of just being a job rather than really trying to help the guest. I even noticed it when they were helping other guests in the lobby. That was a bummer because the first time I stayed here, they were extremely friendly and over the top helpful.Overall, I would recommend this place. Again, for the price, it is convenient, clean, and very affordable.

I read the reviews on this place and I was skeptical. After a 10 hour flight I arrived by taxi to kuhio banyan. I checked in and went up to my room. I could hear a really loud squeezing noise from the toilet. Front desk organised maintenance guy to fix very quickly. The room was more the. Adequate to stay in. Our only concern was the night club down stairs at night. As a smoker we had to go and sit with the drug dealers and what I assume where prostitutes. Didn't really hear the noise from my room once we went back up to the room. Cheap laundry on the second floor 1.25 a wash 1 dollar to dry your clothes. Food pantry not far away.

This our second time staying here. The first wasn't bad but this time we only stayed 2 nights. We were supposed to stay 7. They went nonsmoking 6 months ago. The shower is tiny and silly. No fresh air ventilation. Front desk staff is not friendly or helpful. Would not refund our aborted stay.No onsite parking (try to get one on the street!) Noisy neighborhood. No lanai or opening windows. Etc, etc. will not stay here ever again! Found a better hotel just down the street.

Checking in & out was a breeze. It's more like a 4 story motel but it was pretty well maintained. There were a few ants in the bathroom but nowhere else in the room. Kitchenette was good & living area decent size. Hideaway bed but actually comfortable! There are some restaurants and a small club in courtyard. We were on the 4th floor & couldn't hear much for any of these at night. Front desk has just about everything you need for the beach that you can borrow at no charge.

We were travelling as a family and booking through RCI for a one week timeshare. I booked two units, one for my daughter and one for sister, (our place, Waikiki Banyan was sold out). We have always had anywhere from good to excellent with choices from RCI, but not this time. As were drove up to the hotel our stomachs sank, it's was 1030pm, the bar wad going full tilt, drunks outside, yelling, screaming, and fights. My husband had everyone wait in the car till he found the hotel security guard who helped us with the late checkin. The guard was the best thing about this place, because it went downhill even further. The units were side by side, and neither one had a redeeming feature. The smell of mould and mildew was very strong, the carpet and seating area were stained, the bathroom looked clean, but was in rough shape. At this point we were very tired, the girls went to bed reluctantly. The noise throughout the night continued and the noise of the air con was also very loud. I spent the night online trying to find a new hotel. We checked out the next morning. This hotel needs to be torn down, get rid of the bar, and until then, steer clear. Vert disappointing to be on the RCI system, or even sold as a hotel. The backpackers in downtown Auckland is better.

We had a horrible experience. The murphy bed & couch was extremely uncomfortable & dirty. The unit was old, filthy & not supplied/stocked adequately. The 2 burner stove top was broken. The small refrigerator did not cool adequately. The noise was unbearable & went throughout the night. RCI had recommended this for us & we are devastated. We had booked for one week through RCI & had to leave after the first night. Someone tried to break into our unit 2 times during the night we were there. We had booked for one week through RCI & we can't believe RCI would ever recommend this place. We were forced to get another place on our own to try to salvage our vacation.

Having landed after a 9 hour flight and arriving in Honolulu, we thought we would store our luggage at the hotel and get some breakfast in the area. Unfortunately we were told that check-in is 4pm, there is no available room for me to check in early and there is no luggage storage. I was shocked in disbelief. In my many travels I had never ever been told that there was so storage of luggage at reception. Tired and annoyed, I put all my luggage’s down in front of the reception desk and sat on the chairs in the waiting area.After 5 minutes the receptionist printed some paperwork for me to sign and gave me a tv remote, door swipe and key. The room fan did not work and the air con was loud. Interestingly, the bed was a hidden fold away in a wardrobe (there was only one queen bed, even though the booking request was 2 single beds. I was told that all the suites in this hotel only had one queen bed configurations). The pillows were abominable and flat as a pancake. The room was however, clean and location of the hotel was prime walking distance to everything. Wifi was super slow and even non-existent over 2 days of our stay. We were told that the handyman was fixing the wifi and told to call the telecom company to see why it wasn’t working – this instruction was an even more of a shock to me than the no storage of luggage.A full kitchenette is provided and even a couple hot plates to cook. There is an extra charge for cleaning if you don’t wash everything after use. There is no hair dryer in the bathroom, we had to call reception for one. For some strange reason there wasn’t daily housekeeping in our room. The housekeeper seems to come once over the course of our 4 day stay.The street noise from this room was terrible. There is plenty of noise day and night, especially when the night club below is open late on Saturday nights. Street noise was also considerably loud from this room due to its location and due to the convenience of a bus stop at the front.All in all, this hotel is bare minimal budget – a step above backpacker’s hostels to be honest. If you only need a private room with a lock and don’t want any service, pick this place – having said that there are a lot of better hotels in this price range with much more to offer. I won’t be coming back to this place.

Was traveling for 24h to get there, arrived at the Banyan Hotel only 5min. after they closed the Reception at 10pm because my flight was delayed, there was no help at all! had to spent extra $$ to find a place to be safe. This is the worst option i took so far while traveling in years, seriously ..!!!!Check out the Royal Grove in Waikiki if you are traveling on a low Budget :) Its a better choice !!!

No check in after 10 pm , watch out, if your flight is delayed , or whatever , tough luck , your out $100. The place is closed with only a security guard who is just as frustrated as you'll be . Same building as one of the roughest bars in waikiki . Fights and loud drunks right outside the front doors . Old building with just as old furnishings , my grandma had newer stuff we threw out !!!!. Huge bathroom with mostly closet space and a very small shower ,, ???? I understand You get what you pay for , but this place is not even worth the $100 !! Ya ,, umm NO .. TRAVELERS BEWARE !!

Honestly, this is one of the cheapest options to stay in Waikiki, in THIS sort of location, 10 minute walk to famous Waikiki beach and close to EVERYTHING! If you are looking for a supa-dupa place with luxurious fluffiness, don't choose this hotel!We got it because there are way too many things to do in Waikiki and all we wanted is a bed and a little kitchenette so that we don't have to spend the money for breakfasts...There is a Food Pantry shop next to the hotel which i think is very expensive, so if you have a car i would suggest you buy food from walmart, NOT that food pantry.The bed was pretty comfortable, no complaints. And the room had a stove, tea/coffee making facility, refrigerator and cooking appliances.The rooms are cleaned twice a weekThe reception staff i found quite friendly and helpful (three out of four of them)If you have a car, contact this hotel as there is a guy there that provides secure parking pretty much in front of the hotel at pretty reasonable for Waikiki price.The other great thing about this hotel is - they give you beach towels to use!And they have a laundry in the building (the washing and drying and detergent and all will cost you approximately 4$)The only complaint we had was noise. From the next to us room. If you aren't lucky with the neighbors, unfortunately you are forced to live according to their timing. We had a group of youngsters next to us and had to hush them every night...Overall, good placer - reasonable price, GREAT location and pretty comfortable bed!

If you want to be situated in the centre of Waikiki and you are traveling on a budget, this hotel is for you! It's clean(ish), pretty dated, but it's a comfortable place to hang your hat at the end of a long day at the beach. You can borrow everything you need for the beach (towels, floaties, beach mats, boogie boards, etc.) from the front desk for free.Bus Stops (to various places all over the island) are right outside the front entrance. There's Subway, a Taco Shop, Starbucks, Japanese cuisine, etc. all within 1 block. Lots of quaint (but touristy and pricey) stores in the area, plus a small market with vendors across the street. The beach is about a 5 minute walk.As for the room:Wifi is pretty slow (but it's free)Shower stalls only (no tubs)Kitchen is stocked so you can cook in the room (no oven)Bring your own Shampoo/Conditioner/Razors/etc. (they are not provided)In-room safe includedMy only real complaints with this hotel is that 1) the club below can be a bit loud, but Waikiki is bustling throughout the night in all of the central areas, so it didn't seem like much of a departure from the noise levels any of the other hotels would endure close by. And 2) They won't store your luggage. We had to check out by 10 am and didn't fly out until 10 pm, so we rented a car for the day to explore the island (and stow our luggage in a safe place simultaneously). Other than that, if I was heading on another vacation to Waikiki in the future (and doing it on the cheap), I would stay here again.

review_body: The staff was nice enough; the place clean; adequate kitchenette ~ but hey when you're tired and just wanna go to bed ~ circling the blocks over and over again for a parking space just made me cranky and irritable....There's good bus service though if you don't need a car. Nor was it fun to discover that not only there wasn't a king size bed we had to pull down the murphy bed from the wall and sleep on a queen. And try check out their cancelation policy before you make a reservation because a $250 deposit is required upon arrival and booking through Priceline or Hotwire will also make it impossible to cancel your reservation

Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Hawaii

review_body: On out arrival at 8am we asked if we could leave our suitcases in storage... We got a very stern "we do not store bags" but I suppose u can have ur room... The room was very out dated the bed was a hideaway that was like sleeping on the floor... We suspect someone was going Into our room when we were not there, staff did not clean our room for 2 days ( with the pls make up the room sign on the door) just a really bad experience...good thing... Steve and pearl the activity coordinators were absolutely phenomenal couldn't help us enough...

Great location, bus stops just outside, helpful staff, well-equipped studios and can borrow pretty mush all beach equipment from office office for free. Close to beach, shops and good coffee places. Great value for money. Bed and sofa comfortable, everything worked. Free Wifi. Great Korean barbeque just next door. Very noisy, strip club downstairs open and loud till 3am. AC unit noisy. Can clearly hear activities in neighboring apartments. Hot water only ever tepid. Hard to watch TV when murphy bed down. Bright light all night long - even through drapes.

We stayed for the last four days of February, the location is excellent for your tripping around the Waikiki precinct, Bus at your door step, Food at your doorstep, Shopping at your doorstep, Pink Line Shopping Trolley one block away, Beach a ten minute stroll - walk it out, you don't need a car in Waikiki - we got a car for a day and drove around the island (have done this before) the staff were fantastic, we were on the 4th floor above the nightclub - you can request the other end but we just told the night club we needed a nightcap, the hot water had a problem and the lift had a problem during our stay, the staff were prompt in getting it attended to - this is a quirky accommodation pick so be prepared not compare it with other establishments, a murphy bed just adds qurkiness - they have a laundrette in-house plus a tour desk and having the kitchenette was a bonus - they also gave us a little welcome pack with a few freebies around town - we visited other islands on our trip, this accommodation is good if you don't want to pay top dollar to conglomerates that have created a concrete jungle, because that is what Waikiki is.

Got one of the 'remodeled' rooms, nothing like the pictures. Remodel means they changed the carpet (only in the room), tv and painted part of the room. Not all the units have been remodeled, carpets are severely stained and musty smell is revolting in those rooms. Grout on floor hasn't been cleaned in forever. Outside is filthy because no one cleans grease off of walkways from 4 fast food places and a bar within 30 feet of door. Bed has rubber sheet or something on it, squeaks every time you move. View is of exhaust ducts from grease pits out window and neighboring condos from walkway. Cleaning staff was fantastic, had to re clean the room twice on check in. Lobby is locked most of the time. Next door neighboring condos are noisy until 2am and trash trucks start showing up at 5am. Area is full of student hostels.

My stay was feb 9th to feb 11th. The staff was nice, there was a helpful man at the front desk who assisted with storing our bags since our flight was later that day. The room was good, clean room, roof over my head. I had low expectations after reading reviews but it ended up the total opposite of that. The little bar down stairs never disturbed me one bit. Got in and out perfectly fine! I got what I needed for a low price, and had a great experience :)

This "resort" advertises that their studio sleeps 4. We stayed here 3 years ago, and there was a Queen murphy bed and two single day beds, thereby it slept 4 people. Now we show up 3 years later, and they have replaced the daybeds with a sofa (not a sleeper or click clack) and a chair. So there is no possible way to sleep 4, and 3 can sleep there only if someone sleeps on the couch. It is in a great location - only 1.5 blocks to Waikiki beach, so we love the location.They now have free wi-fi, but it is very weak signal and tough to get locked into a signal, and we are only one room away from the lobby.Most of the staff is friendly, but there is one woman who just won't smile, no matter how much you smile at her. We've seen a few very small ants, but it is Hawaii, so that's what happens here.

You can't beat the location and the price but the place is in serious need of updating. The carpet was old and very stained. I didn't want to walk around barefoot. The best part of this place is the staff!!! The staff all went out of their way to be helpful. All were great to chat with and ask about the Island. Keep the staff and do some updates to make this perfect...

review_body: I have nothing but positives to say about the place.Excellent location and the price couldn't be beat!The units have been TOTALLY REDONE!!So the negative comments of a previous time should not be taken into consideration at all at this time.Feel assured this is a great place.Units are small... after all they are studios.. at least the ones we booked.Murphy bed in the wall... very quaint and modern living room and Kitchen.Kitchen has everything you need. No oven is all.Microwave, Fridge, 2 burner stove.. and all the utensils to make you feel at home.Great bang for your buck......... don't lose sleep over choosing this hotel... it's great and very central.If this was helpful to you in any way... leave me a helpful vote.

So I have this layover from LAX-HNL-AKL. I don't feel like staying at the airport and I don't need to stay at $299 Starwood or Ritz this or that (I am traveling alone - single male - 40s). Just need a bed and a place to crash. Mixed reviews, but the $95.90 total price, tax tag title, piqued my interest and seemed like the gamble I would be willing. Sure, it is not the ritz and it is sketchy on the outside, but the location is pristine (near Waikiki as I want to hit the beach for four hours this am before returning for the 9 hour flight to AKL). I had to pay for parking along Koa and Kanekapolei for $15 (you cannot leave your bags at HNL so you have to pick up your checked bags and I am not dragging around 15 days of New Zealand clothing this morning). Anyway, the bed was clean and the room as clean - bathroom nice - coffee maker worked - in-window air conditioning unit drowned out any street noise - stayed in room 313. For less than $100 in January two blocks from Waikiki - unless you are traveling with demanding snob-types or those who cannot live without pre-packaged body oils being strewn about rose petal littered jacuzzi bathtubs ... go for it.

Stayed only a night in Honolulu on our return from the Big island but regretted not spending more time here after our stay at the Kuhio Banyan Club. Great price, huge small apartment sized rooms and a Kitchen with all the utensils what could go wrong. Water took a little time to heat up and the air conditioner was rather noisy but only minor issues that can be easily put up with in this excellent well valued accommodation.

Before booking my hotel I always read the reviews, needless to say for Kuhio Banyan there was plenty of skepticism. I arrived & my expectations were beyond low from the reviews listed. Upon arrival I was only unsure of the entrance, it is located directly in the middle of the shopping plaza. Yes, there is a small bar outside and no it did not not in any way bother or interrupt my sleep. My stay was for 10 days and only my first night after a 12hr flight did the music get to me. The staff is friendly and helpful. I actually LOVED the location! Yes, this hotel is also a bit dated but who cares I was there to spend my time outdoors not inside. The great thing is they also offer free rentals including beach towels/chairs/umbrellas, boogie boards etc. You do have to ask for an iron, blow dryer, ironing table, if you would like one and you have to bring your own toiletries (shampoo & conditioner). I actually have no complaints at all for this hotel, I would definitely stay here again.

Like others- I so wish I would have read the reviews before I started!They over billed me and blamed it on the travel agent who blames it on them. To enjoy the true aloha spirit- don't stay here! Being overcharged and getting the runaround 'almost' ruined our vacation.

We stayed here for a couple of nights with our grand daughters aged 9 and 11. The location of the place is excellent, minutes from the beach at Waikiki. The staff are friendly and the room was clean. The pullout bed could have been a bit softer, but was OK. The girls slept comfortably on sofa beds. All in all good value for money. Would definitely stay here agin.

The location is close to restaurants and shopping. The staff at the front desk are very friendly and made us feel welcomed.The property is older but clean. Our room was quiet. We were only there for one night.

Kuhio has a pretty convenient location and the price is good for Waikiki, but be sure not to get a room on the 1st or 2nd floor because there is a night club in the same building on street level. The building is basically an old apartment building, so don't expect anything resembling luxury. However, rest assured that there's a nice closet for your clothes...in the bathroom. Who came up with that?Also, note that there is no parking. This can be an issue since parking in Waikiki is terrible. Waikiki Gateway is where we stayed last time, and if recall it was cheaper and included parking, just book several months in advance.

i don't even know where to begin to express what a horrible hotel this is. the desk closes at 10 PM and then if you arrive after that you have to make special arrangements and give a $250 deposit for the keys which is not refundable upon checkout but only when the room has been cleaned and you are well on your way home. to get the locked away keys, one needs to find the night attendant somewhere on the street. the rooms are outdated, the carpets filthy, and underneath the clean sheets are the most disgustingly squalid box springs i have ever seen. there was what looked like a blood stain on the side of the mattress. i looked for evidence of bedbugs but did not see any. there was evidence of termites at the foot of one of the tables as a pile of sawdust was never vacuumed away. one gets a Murphy bed to sleep in and the TV is as old as Methuselah without a remote or flat screen. no hairdryer in the rooms. one has to go to the front desk to borrow one. the kitchenette seems decent but i would not even use it as the cooktop had wipe marks all over it. the fridge was the only decent thing in the room. it was fairly large and worked well. the bathroom was clean but outdated. we only stayed one night and that was too long. go for the 30 or 40 bucks more and get a better hotel. btw, no parking available at hotel. went to pro-park nearby and that is a scam in itself. long story. i would never stay here again or even mention this hotel to anyone. they do have state of the art keyless entry but better they should have spent that money on some refurbishing. this place is not worth the bargain price as it is no bargain.

Yes, this is possibly the only place where they allowed us to park even if we did not stay there ($15/day which is very great rate compared to others). My boyfriend who took care of our rental was impressed how helpful and friendly the staff was. THey even gave him a lei!

This was one of the most disappointing stays I've had. Sure, its price is low and the location is good, but when you can't sleep at night because the mattress is older than you and the lighting in the bathroom is so bad you can't see yourself in the shower, there's a problem. Everything in our room was showing its age. The one exception was the new key-less door locks they installed during the stay which we had to listen to. I'd never stay here again. Sleep deprivation and modern furnishings aren't worth saving a few bucks a night.

This hotel is not 'flash' but it is well located and very suitable for the budget traveller. The ' bed in the cupboard' works well actually as it allows greater room space during the day. The small kitchenette could work if you want to cook....but why bother as the savings on accommodation can be well expended on dining out - after all you are on vacation ! Be aware that the front desk closes down at 10pm and opens at 7:00am - between these hours you are on your own. In summary this hotel is not 'the Ritz' however at the price it's location and amenity is pretty good! The hotel nominated Reliable Shuttle as their preferred transport to/fro the airport and these guys certainly lived up to their namesake - no issues in getting an early morning airport shuttle run - just ensure you leave one key at the front desk prior to the 10:00pm close on the night before departure, the other stays in your room....along with the TV remote!

I stayed in this hotel for four nights while I was attending a conference. I was on my own. For me, when in a place like Hawaii, the hotel is a place to sleep, and that's pretty much it. Kuhio Banion was old and not fancy, but my room was clean. With jet lag, I was up early most mornings, and it took a LONG time for the shower to get hot. I loved the location - it is close to the beach, restaurants, and shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful. There is a nice little kitchen complete with dishes and cookware for 4, so you could eat in if that was your preference. I would not stay here if you're trying to impress your significant other, but if you want an affordable place to sleep while in Hawaii, this just might be the place for you!

The Kuhio Banyan Club is by no means a luxury stay, but it isn't disgusting by any means. The room was clean.The murphy bed was actually very comfortable and it has a great location. There are many dining options available nearby and the beach is a block away. The hotel checks out beach equipment and towels. It is an affordable option for a pricey place to stay!

Upside - very reasonably priced (but add in parking) and a block from the beach - Has a/c - not all do. Complimentary - beach chairs, towels, bamboo mats and swim gear from the front desk. Nice staff and very helpful. Subway (for day hikes) and Starbucks, just out the door. Souvenir shop street merchants in alley on the way to the beach - don't buy anywhere else...Downside - no parking - have to unload in restaurant delivery truck unloading-only parking at the end of the block and overnite park a few blocks away ($35/night for parking - but can get $10/day off if you have proof you are at Kuhio Banyon). Old and tired property - this is a time share - can't imagine the sales pitch for this....it has the tiniest elevator I've ever seen - two friendly people - we took the stairs after the first ride. Street noises start early .If you are looking for luxury - keep going - if just sleeping between beaches and hiking - a pretty good deal.

My son & I celebrated our June birthdays in Waikiki, it was our first time to Hawaii. My friend suggested this place for lodging. It's not elegant but it is very nice and centrally located to every thing. All the staff were so kind and ready to assist you to ensure you had a great time. We checked out beach towels, boogie boards and water float rings (free), we rented snorkeling gear every thing was very clean, you could tell that they take pride in all their equipment. We were able to get parking for a couple nights @ $15/day in a very nice parking garage, they gave us the name of the parking person who was a really nice man (suggest you request his number when you reserve your room so you can call and reserve parking) Pearl, the activity director went beyond the call of duty she booked our Luau and transportation for us. Wow we loved our stay so much that we are going back for the Thanksgiving break to finish our sight seeing! We are able to go back because it was so affordable and we had a spectacular time!

The staff was really nice and accomodating, it is the perfect place for someone on a budget. The hotel is close to everything. There is a lot of night life outside of the hotel including a late night club.

This is an old run down timeshare. It is in a GREAT location just one block form Waikki beach , restaurants and night life. We had a great time in Oahu...Hanama Bay may be the best snorkeling I have ever experienced. Manua Falls were pretty and well worth the beautiful hike. Of course, Himing up a Diamond Head, a lui, and visiting Pearl Harbor were great experiences. I loved the fact that you can snorkel and hike during the day but then there is so much night life in the evening. I will definitely visit this island gain but there is NO way I would EVEr stay at the Kuhio Banyan Club again...it's a real pit!!!!!

Front Desk personnel friendly enough very old school paperwork process No complaints really.Room was dated, dark and in need of upgrade but for what it is alright. It had plenty of room big bathrooms but very small dark shower with 70s tile that you had to step up into and fridge in both rooms in the main room we had a small cook top but we didn't use it. The small coffee pot in the room had a special size small brew basket with one coffee bag for the entire stay. You can purchase additional ones for a buck a piece no thank you. Bed comfort was ehh definitely had better. The air conditioning was window air and they worked fine. Surrounding the hotel well basically the same complex was a noisy nightclub that interfered with our sleep that stayed open until 4 am. We didn't have much choice because our trip was short planned so this was only available to us through our timeshare program at that time so it worked but I wouldn't pay the price they charge outside a timeshare program. Location was decent easy walk to area shopping, restaurants, the beach and did I mention the beach? Asking the front desk for beach towels was an ok process. So in short its ok wouldn't choose to stay there again if could avoid it. But you're in paradise so you don't have to be stuck in your room if its only one available its bearable. But we are timeshare owners who expect a better caliber unit and may be harsher in this review than others but hey it worked, we didn't die and in the long run we can say we were in Hawaii

super old school hotel and super dirty. they use actual keys and not key cards.they file everything with paperwork so it takes forever to check in because apparently they dont want to update their computer systems. no balconies at all. you could here everything going on outside and there was a shady looking club right next to the hotel. wouldnt stay here again.

We are smokers and it's hard to find a room in Waikiki. This place has a few above the nightclub. There are no windows to open (but some skinny ones in the large bathroom) and no lanai. The AC is a wall unit. Leave it blowing and you won't hear much street noise. The room was OK - the bathroom is large with 2 large closets (but a very small dark shower), the kitchenette is adequate, and the location is OK but you have to park your car a few blocks away for $20 per 24 hours. Who cares about a pool when the beach is 2 block away?? Next time we will look for a better place with a lanai!

Cheap.. means cheap. Biggest bummer is the huge! $250 damage deposit they charge. Ridiculous. Other than that it was ok... for the price. Bed was hard. Street noise was all night long. However! Being raised in the 80's it was like stepping into my youth!

We booked this hotel on Priceline for 6 nights but was so disappointed after our first night there that we checked out the following day and stayed in a different hotel. The room they gave us smelled of mildew and there was no air circulation because there were no windows that we can open for fresh air. Outside our room, we faced a dilapidated apartment building that was inches away from our door. We bought a candle to dissipate the smell but it was as bad when we woke up the next morning. The thought of going back to the hotel after we went to the beach just terrified us thus we just decided to leave. The whole building should be torn down. Priceline would not refund our money, that was another nightmare we had to deal with.

I knew that when we reserved our timeshare exchange via RCI, that this hotel was not what I was used to. There is no pool. Parking was across the street at another hotel and you pay a guy cash for access to parking. The front desk staff was really nice. Room was kinda old and warn but clean. Room is small but does have a little kitchenette. If you stay there, you need to eat at the Udon House right in front of the site. It is wonderful.

Okay...Seriously no pool???? And the shower was terrible!!! The green carpet was scary. If you stay here make sure you don't face Kuhio Avenue (noise from nightclub). The staff were fantastic!Sorry never ever staying here again.

When you walk in your room, you walk straight into the Golden Girls! All in pastel 80s colours and decor/furniture. The room was big with a Murphy bed, 2 couches and a kitchenette. A/C worked fine. Now the things to be aware of: 1) if you arrive after 10pm you have to call them in advance to get the code for the safe with your key. They won't email it, so if you are overseas you have to make the long distance call. 2) there is no on site parking, and the close-by parking is $25 for 24 hours. It adds up. 3) opposite the road from my room was a construction site. That was not a big deal though, because they didn't work at night. 4) outside my room was a nightclub. That was a big deal, because I heard the bass all night.Staff was very friendly, especially the lady at the check-in.Would I stay here again? Probably not.

I was expecting budget hotel lodgings. I got upper-middle accomodations.The room and hotel were clean and well maintained. The unit was well equipped with microwave, mini-fridge, hot plates and all the necessary utensils. The murphy bed was comfortable, and the spaces nicely furnished.The staff, at the desk, at the concierge center, and the cleaning crew all did an excellent job in making the Kuhio Banyan my new favorite hotel in Waikiki.

Friendly and helpful staff, good value for money, good kitchen facilities, clean, handy to shops and buses, but right next to a night club so noisey and hard to sleep at night, we stayed a week, every night party central, great if you're partying with the peeps downstairs but i brought two kids...

This hotel is located in an excellent location, only two blocks from Waikiki Beach. However, this establishment is somewhat dated and has no facilities, like pool or exercise room, to recommend it.The rooms are OK for one or two people, but four is a crowd in the small rooms.Check-in and check-out is quick and painless, unless you are checking out on a Saturday morning when all the time share users are also checking out.So it boils down to a trade-off: great location versus lower than average price.

Over all good stay stayed three days, OLDER 60'S property. Murphy bed( you have to pullit down from the wall).y. making it somewhat noisy..t room was over a restruant.... 2 blocks from beach numerous reateruants near

This place was not bad at all if you realize you are not getting 5 star but more like 3 star room wise and you are in hawaii to take in the island and not the tv you cant see when the bed is down! Everything is as advertised and my only big disagrement from previous posts is that the ladys at the front desk were extremly helpful! So again! 5 star no.. 3 star yes.. Does it have all you need?? Yes! Is it affordable? Yes!! Thank you Banyan Club for an excellent visit!Jayme from NJ

Once again I stayed at the Banyan Club. The room was clean and smelled fresh. The murphy bed which we loved was clean and comfortable. The kitchen is ok even though I wish we had an oven. No, you can not watch tv from your bed but then who really cares. The location is fantastic. The staff was very friendly and we even got into our room early. I recommend this place however DO NOT expect a 5 star timeshare.

I actually really enjoyed staying at Kuhio Banyan club. The location is perfect, literally 5 minutes away from central Waikiki. The rooms were nice sized. I really enjoyed having the kitchen (fully stocked with coffee maker, toaster, pots and pans, cups, plates etc.. so you can make breakfast or snacks whenever you want, which was very convenient!). I also enjoyed having the 2 couches... when you come home from a long day at the beach and just want to relax, it was great to just sit on them and chill out for a bit (versus some hotel rooms that only have a bed to sit on.. not nearly as comfortable). My friend and i were able to come home some nights and just drink a bottle of wine and chat on the couch, very cozy.The bed is a pull down, which at first was slightly hilarious (have never seen that before!) but honestly it was comfortable enough and you get 4 pillows, which was nice. Some people complain that the place wasn't clean - i found it to be perfectly clean. The cleaning service only comes twice a week, which for some travelers may be off putting, but really if you're just using the room as a place to sleep, it doesn't matter much. They give you plenty of towels to last you that long.I stayed at the Maile Sky Court before (a better rated hotel) but I actually prefer the Kuhio Banyan club more. The Maile sky court room was more expensive and was much smaller (no couches), so the room wasnt as comfortable to come home to. Yes, it's more of your average hotel, so it was cleaner and more modern, but if you don't care as much about cleaning service or front desk manners, then stay at the Kuhio banyan hotel - a great budget friendly hotel.Downside: No parking, and parking in Waikiki is an extreme pain. Also, it is near a club and other bars, so on busy nights the noise was a little loud, but hey - buy some ear plugs and it's fine.

The rate is super inexpensive, considering within walking distance to Waikiki beach. Unfortunately, one needs to supply one's own shampoo and conditioner. So when I approached staff for printing needs, they were very generous, which was a very pleasant surprise. One of the staff, Joanie was friendly and professional. She went above and beyond the call of duty to meet my requests and answer my questions.

I stayed here for nine days with my fiance and we ended up enjoying our stay! He is a very "beach-front-resort" kind of man while I could camp outside and be fine. As such, I had few complaints about this place as compared to him! The bed was a little uncomfortable, the TV was old school and not visible when the bed was down, but the benefit of having a kitchenette was invaluable! On top of that, the club provides you with the chance to check out boogie boards, floats, coolers, and beach chairs for your whole stay! The reviews are definitely true that the night clubs outside are LOUD. Play Bar is right downstairs and they go until 4:00am. We were both able to sleep just fine but I can see this being a downside, especially for families. There is no pool and there is pretty much no parking to be found so keep that in mind! Overall, I would say that as long as you are okay with a bit of an old school style hotel, the location and price is definitely right at the Kuhio Banyan! The staff there were very friendly and helpful and we loved having a Food Pantry, ABC, and key bus stops so close. Just be warned: go in there expecting the Marriott and you'll surely be disappointed. As long as you keep an open mind and are on a lower budget, this is a great place to stay!
