review_body: As other reviews say, this place is very dated and the neighboring apartment building looked terrible. It was clean and tidy and would be good if, like us, you were only planning on sleeping in the room and not spending much other time than that in there. Something we didn't like about this hotel is that, check in time is no later than 10pm. Our flight got in at 9:30pm, so there was no way we were going to make it. Kuhio banyan said that if we wanted to check in after 10pm, we would have to pay them $250USD for someone to come and do it - we passed and stayed with a friend. The next morning we went in to check in. It was well before check in time but we figured, since we had had the room booked since the previous day, the room would be available for us - it wasn't. We were told there wasn't a room for us and that they had probably given it away. How can they give it away when we had paid for it? We ended up having to go back after 3pm to check in. We were tempted not to stay but because we had already booked and paid for the accommodation through booking.com, we were unable to get a refund. We had booked for 5 nights, didn't get to stay the first night, stayed for the next 3 nights, then decided to leave early and stay with friends on the last night. Overall we wouldn't stay at this place again.

Clean tidy rooms with mostly friendly service. We were quite happy having kitchen facilities in our room. Radio didn't work and air con leaked. Would stay here again though because of how well kept the hotel was.

What a disappointment. I was embarrassed to stay there. The furniture was worn out and dirty. Looked like funk on the end table. Worn out Murphy bed. Ancient TV. Stereo with cassette deck. Funny thing when the bed is out you can't watch TV. Have to sign for ironing board, and iron pops circuit breaker. Front desk ladies were rude. Designated days and times to use the washer and dryers and you still you have to go to front desk because house keeping had them filled. Probably the worst part is the night clubs out the front door, loud! Prostitutes hanging out in the front during the night. No parking available. No swimming pool. Room cleaned one time during the week. Not much good to say except it is close to Waikiki.

This place is not so bad. Location is great, staff is not friendly but accommodating and helpful when needed. Rooms are not very clean but livable, very large and nicely equipped. I think great great value. Water sports equipment and beach towels are provided. This is not a hotel it is a time share, so you need to make special arrangement with the reception for late check-in or you will be stuck out side. It can be quite noisy at night. But I'd stay here again.

review_body: 2 benefits to this location...this was a timeshare swap, it took very few points compared to other timeshares locations (17k for the week I think) and it is right in the midst of Wakiki..one block over is the beachfront.It was however...small, worn out, pink....very pink..the bathroom showerhead had fungus growing on it, mold in the corner of the shower, the carpet was worn and questionable. The pull down murphy bed (unit only slept 2) was VERY heavy, if you are not able to lift or carry anything heavy...do not take one of these units.The staff...the little woman who cleans (I only saw one cleaning lady) was very nice, but did not clean as well as she could have.The front desk staff...were always on the defensive, even if you just walked by and stopped to say hello!..posture and behavior were.."What now"..not very helpful in regards to anything in the area..did not know where to get a pizza, although there was a pizza place right across the street and down a few buildings. I didn't see any roaches or bugs..but the carpet scared me enough not to go barefoot..ever.There are no washer/dryers available with these unitsALSO..no parking available..they have made a deal with a sketchy looking guy..to park in a garage down the street for 15 a night, which was the cheapest we found there. It worked out OK, but made the stay a little more costly then we had expected.

Don't get me wrong,we like it. It is in the center of everything in Waikiki . If you are looking for luxury go somewhere else. Nothing has been updated,the room has a stereo with a cassette deck and a record player. Clean and cheep .a good value for the price. I would stay again.

PROS:- PRICE & LOCATION: Right in the middle of Waikiki. Perfect if you don't have a car and a few minute's walk to everything including beach, bus stops, and Food Pantry (very importantly if you plan to cook your own meals). Got a queen room w/ kitchenette (I think they all have kitchenettes) for about $95/night w/ tax. This place is not worth more than that. We also loved that it's right next to the best udon place in Waikiki - Marukame Udon (great, fast, cheap eat).- KITCHENETTE W/ SUPPLIES: Room comes w/ mini fridge, microwave, 2-burner stove, dishes, pots, pans, utensils, and roll of paper towel. - FRIENDLY & HELPFUL STAFF: There's someone at the front desk from 7am-10pm. Beach towels, beach umbrellas, coolers available to check out for free. I think other things like boogie board and snorkel equipment costs money. Staff also allowed us to check in early (check in time was listed as after 4pm but we got our room at 1pm), held our luggage, checked us in for our flight and printed our boarding passes. There's also a night security guard. Yes there is a club downstairs but we never saw any shady people hanging around during our 7 night stay but it was nice to know there's a security guard.OK:- BED: not luxurious but had a foam top and was comfortable enough.CONS:- OLD & RUNDOWN FEEL: old worn out carpet (I never went barefoot) and furniture, water stains on the ceiling, but the linens, kitchen area, and bathroom were clean which is what I really cared about.- WINDOWS DON'T OPEN, ROOM VERY DARK: windows are tinted purple and don't open which means there's no natural ventilation and even during the day w/ the shades open, the room felt very dark and dingy. Because the windows didn't open we avoided cooking anything that could make our stuff smell. There is an AC unit and at least there's a ceiling fan for some air movement. W/o the fan on, the room could smell a little stale due to lack of fresh air but we didn't notice any odors.- SMALL ROOMS: with the murphy bed down there's hardly any space to walk around. Not comfortable for more than 2 people and especially not for children or older people. - NOISY: it's in an busy area w/ a club so was only bad on Friday & Saturday nights. I'm a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me much.- NO PARKING: don't plan on having a car here.- NO WIFI: didn't really matter since we used our phone for internet but bad if you plan to have a laptop.OVERALL: This was a last minute trip and I didn't spend much time looking for lodging. Since we stayed 7 nights and wanted to cook for ourselves (some of the meals), I would look instead for a nicer more comfortable condo with parking (there seems to be lots of those for rent near the canal- look on Tripadvisor). We didn't plan on spending much time in our room which is why we got a cheap older centrally located place but the time we did spend in there cooking and eating wasn't all that great because the room felt cramped and dingy.

As an airline employee, I am a frequent traveler to many destinations including Waikiki. I've always stayed at Aston and Outrigger Hotels, but they were filled this time. Booked this place via BOOK IT. Arrived at the hotel, checked in and was told they need an extra $250 as deposit that they hold till you've checked out. I say, "WHAT?" This is not even mentioned when I booked the hotel. The receptionist told me I should have read the details of the hotel and their requirements. I've never had to pay $$$ for a hold at any classy hotel in the past. Meanwhile, this place is a dump. Noise, filthy carpet on floors, we never used their kitchenette because of the grime. The shower stall needs a whole bottle of bleach to wash off of the mold. The TV remote from yesteryear kept malfunctioning so we had to keep taking it to reception to have it reprogrammed. The pics posted on the site is perhaps from 30 years ago or longer; so this is false advertising. The room smelt of burnt fried eggs, you could not get rid of the odor. Only advantage: conveniently located. I do not suggest you bring your children to this hotel. It is dirty. The sheets smelled musty...don't know whether the sheets on the couches, which doubles as beds are ever changed or aired. I would not recommend this hotel at all. A room at the Maile Sky Court is 100% better and charges the same amount for a room and can fit a family of 4.

I'll start with the positives:1. Good locationNow on to the negatives:1. "Murphy bed", aka a hard cot attached to a wall2. Terrible smelling room3. Stains on walls, carpet and toilet4. Toilet didn't flush5. Window was stuck open in bathroom6. Noisy club below7. Nightly bum fights outside8. Unfriendly staff [Quote of the trip: "This ain't no hotel, its a timeshare"]9. Zero security - terrible if you're traveling alone.10. No housekeeping to speak of. Want fresh towels? Too bad. I could keep going, but I think you get the gist....

Me & my wife stayed for a week here on a late timeshare trip. If U like a pull down bed from the wall and the loud music from a bar/club downstairs until 4am this place is for you. I forgot to mention there is no security but the police were there every night for the fights outside. Was not told room service was only done once a week so plan on finding somewhere to dispose on the garbage. We've travel to many country's and stay in many hotels and this by far was the worst ! Best part was coming home..

I actually found this Hotel through Booking.com and man am I satisfied with it. Now, let me tell you right away, it's not luxurious to say the least. It is pretty much your most basic of accommodations, but when you're in Hawaii what more do you need than a clean place to sleep and shower? I was barely in the room the whole time I was there and it was perfect. My room even had a small kitchenette which really saved me from having to eat out all the time. I brought some small food things with me from home and went to Walmart or Food Pantry (which is two blocks away) for other basic food items. Eating out can get expensive in Hawaii, not to mention not always healthy, so it was nice to have a small fridge, two burner stove, and a microwave. They also supplied all the utensils, pots, pans, etc. Even a can opener! The staff is really friendly and were patient with all my questions I had about the bus. (which is conveniently located right outside the front door) The only thing I had trouble with was locating it when I first arrived. You must enter from the courtyard next to the Nail Salon. There is a Subway sandwich place right in front of the lobby. I really enjoyed my stay there and I would not only stay there again, but recommend it to anyone.

My wife and I are retired senior citizens who needed a place to sleep so we could catch a next day flight to another island after a later arrival at Honolulu International. We had made a reservation through Priceline and received a confirmation from Priceline. We never received any confirmation from the Kuhio Banyan Club but were not concerned assuming there would be someone on site to check us in. Upon arrival at about 11:30 PM we noted a locked door with office hours that closed at 10:00 PM. There was a security guard onsite who tried his best to help us. He made several phone calls to Kuhio Banyan managers and staff but none were willing to come to the "hotel" and let us in. At about 1:30 AM we finally gave up and returned to the airport where we thought we would just wait in the terminal for our flight at 12:30 PM with a hope that maybe we could get on an earlier flight as standby. Unfortunately the terminal was closed and we ended up staying at an airport hotel. I complained to the Kuhio Banyan Club and asked for a refund. They offered a free stay at a later date. Bottom line was Kuhio Banyan accepted no responsibility to have someone on site and said it was my responsibility to let them know we were going to arrive late. However they sent me no confirmation stating this policy and indicated either my wife and I or Priceline was at fault. My guess is they were full and had no rooms available and that is why no Kuhio Banyan staff was willing to come and help us. I will say the security tried very hard to help us and it was “hotel” staff who were not helpful.

The best features of Kuhio Banyan hotel in Waikiki is its location and its price. The location could not get better (aside from the luxurious hotels on the waterfront). You are right in heart of Waikiki within short walking distance to all major attractions. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel, which was important to me as I have used it. For instance, I have went by bus to Pearl Harbor, which was a very memorable experience. I did not want to take an organized tour as I wanted to set my own steady pace to explore that place.  Now, the price is high, but it is probably cheapest one in the area. Now, one of my airport shuttle bus drivers has mentioned that one can find even cheaper accommodations, but Kuhio was clearly the cheapest in the list of hotels offered by most hotel search engines that I have looked at prior to my trip. Now, their reception closing at 10 p.m. is obviously a bizarre feature, and that is mentioned in lost of review. I suppose that many flights get into Honolulu airport late in the evening, so this creates a difficulty for people checking in Kuhio. I have made it there by 9:50 p.m., so I was lucky. Two ladies at the reception were ready to run out of this place. I wonder what is behind this policy... Trying to earn more money for the hotel (calling security guard and paying him 45 bucks just to get to your room after many hours of flying)? Possibly.If you believe that you will be not making to this hotel for the check-in before 10 p.m. do call them in advance. I did and they were quite nice to me and provided me with a phone number of a security guard, so that I would not have to wait for him to show up next to a closed hotel door for too long. They have also provided me with a pin code to a safe where my room was to be. They only do it when you call them and not via e-mail. Anyway, they had time to make me go through a lot of paperwork before letting me off and going home themselves. I have never ever seen so many receipts and signed so many receipts before while checking in a hotel, and I am a frequent traveler. Yes, they charge 50 dollars a night as a security deposit for the incidentals right away. I worried about it a little, but to their credit, they have released the charged amount to my account rather quickly upon my checking-out. Now, the room was all right. TV, air conditioner, coffee-maker, fridge were functioning fine. Well, A/C was little noisy, but one does need it on all night long in Waikiki. Bathroom was all right, but I had to fix the toilet flash occasionally as water just kept on running otherwise. The room is quite spacious, of a studio type. The bed was comfortable, pillows were too. Bedclothes were clean. So, I wonder what other reviewers have referred to, or, maybe, they have got worse rooms than I did.  There is a noisy disco downstairs. I was fortunate to have a room at the very end of that wing of the hotel, which is opposite to where the disco is. So, it did not bother me, but I can guess that it is much more disturbing in some other rooms. The cleaning of the room was not done even once through my 4 days and 5 nights of stay there. So, this could be seen as a problem by some people. The area around the hotel is all right. Yes, you see lots of beggars and street walkers as well, but so what. They are harmless and you just walk by them and mind your business. So, in short, Kuhio Banyan has made it for me.

This hotel is located in a busy area and very noisy. I was trying to cancel my booking from this hotel after I had accidentally clicked the wrong tab. I had contacted them trying to cancel my reservation in the early hours of the morning hours before any check-in is authorized and they refused to refund given it was human error. The reception is rude from the personnel working and the policy is flawed. I found the grounds to be old and unkempt and a thoroughly dissatisfying experience with this place. If you want to be placed in a bad mood, deal with these people

My husband and I had the most awful experience on your first time share Hotel at the Kuhio Banyan Club. We got off the plain and got the the Hotel if you called that a hotel,we got their around 10:30 or so it was closed know one their. We we thought what the heck a few mins later a securitygard came. He took us to our room and it was just filthy mold in the fridge, dirty towels all over the bathroom. I was sick to my stomach I could not believe it, the security gard was very helpful. He took us to another room it was clean but not for a time share, we were told every time share has a pool hot tubs and etc. it had nothing like that I was appaulled about the hole thing, Attention to all travellers check really goog were you will be staying. If you go to Hawaii do not say at the Kuhio Banyan Club yours truly Ute Der

Our plane got in at 10:30pm and I phoned the night before to ask why the hotel or reception was closed at10:00pm. The front desk told me that there would be a security guard waiting and have your PIN number ready to get your room key because we were checking in late. I said "0k cool". When we got there, we saw hookers and some undesirable people around, and we were carrying our luggage and we couldn't find the entrance like normal hotels you go to. Everything was closed and had security gates pulled down and I'm thinking to myself, WTF is going on here. The door to the hotel was locked and didn't see no security guard around or no buzzer to hit to let anybody you know that you are here. My wife is crying and I'm thinking with these people and hookers hanging around that we were gonna get robbed and get killed that night. There is a night club right next door.Nice. Eventually the security guy comes down and let's us in and we get to our room and to our surprise, the room Was Not made from the previous people who stayed there, and the little bar fridge was all moldy and towels everywhere on the floor. I called security and he let us in another room and he was the only good thing about that hotel (when he is working.) They get mad when you ask for fresh towels the next day, they said, "what, you used all the towels already!? So if you like people yelling on all hours of the night from the night club and sirens going off every night and not having fresh towels and riding a death trap of an elevator. Kuhio Banyan Club is the place for you. Oh yeah, if you like paying daily taxes for the room too about $16 per night.

If you're thinking of staying here, DON'T DO IT! We booked several nights at this hotel in Waikiki because it was cheap, and we assumed some of the bad reviews were written by snobs so we made the mistake of ignoring them. We arrived from the the airport at 12 am. Our flight had been delayed, but my confirmation from Orbitz stated that check-in time was between 4pm and 10am....so I assumed it was a 24 hour hotel and didn't bother calling from the airport. Not the case. We ran into a nice security guard that explained it would be a $45.00 fee for the hotel manager to drive over with our room key. We said that was fine and waited for over an hour for the manager to answer his or her phone, but ultimately the three employees that were contacted all refused to bring us a key. So we were left stranded in Waikiki with our hiking packs in the middle of the night. Awesome. We never got a refund from the hotel or from Orbitz, who really made the mistake here. So a week later for our next reservation at Kuhio Banyan, we expected the worse....which we determined would be if there were no beds in the room. We go up to the room, and don't see a bed.....because it pulled out of a closet. A cardboard box would have been much better. After we settled in we made our way out for dinner, and while passing through the front lobby we heard a Japanese girl yelling from inside a utility closet. Somehow she got locked in there? The lady at the front desk was on the phone and wasn't phased by us letting her know what was going on, but she did get up to unlock the door at least....and out comes running this girl who looked like she was about to cry. But then it gets worse. When we get back from dinner I take the elevator up and get locked in there. First of all the location is walking distance (in Minutes) from the best Waikiki has to offer. Secondly the staff is great and helpful; free large beach towel/blankets you keep during your stay...boogie boards...coolers...beach chairs...All Free, just ask the desk. Our daughter works nearby for Jimmy Buffet in the/Ohana Beachcomber-Now Holiday Inn and it was less than a block away...Waikiki Beach (on the sand) 2.5 blocks...You are right in the action...sure the area is a bit noisy, a lot of people on the street, but the condo/room was quiet and we slept well.  Waikiki/Honolulu is a LARGE city and has the reputation of terrible traffic (worse than LA according to BLOOMBERG 2012) So it can be noisy...so go to the Big Island-Maui or for no sound Kauai. People complain too much...Parking is all around, but it is VERY expensive, if you have to have a car, you have to bite the bullet. Kuhio Banyan is The Best Value In Waikiki...Where else can you get a kitchenette in prime real estate for this low of a price. Want to go for peace and quiet for a 70's style hotel...then North Shore's Turtle Beach is for you...But Bring Your Credit Cards...better bring 2.... About 70% of Hawaii's total population lives on Oahu and Oahu is one of Hawaii's smaller islands with tall mountains in the middle. Just save your hotel money, rent a car for a day or two.. Enjoy your stay...Do as little or as much as you like...Climb Diamondhead...go to Waimanalo Beach (East Shore) Kailua and com back to Honolulu thru the Pali Highway. Or go on to the North Shore (winter has the big waves) The town of Haleiwa ...stop and get a "Plate Lunch" at Teds Bakery at Sunset Beach" "Hawaiian Shave Ice" from truck venders on your journey around...With Jaw dropping views everywhere.

Stayed at the Kuhio for a few days then changed to another location due to a wedding. Found it to be reasonable as far as ambiance. No pool, but the beach is very close by. review_body: The noise was intolerable at times, especially weekends. I can handle the noise from the street but the noise from the club downstairs and from its patrons was more than I could take. We left early and stayed at another hotel anticipating a noisy Friday night crowd. If you are there for the night life, then this is the ticket for you. Centrally located, it's and easy stumble back to you room from anywhere, especially from the club downstairs. We had two adjoining rooms, well furnished, very clean. The toilets, however, didn't flush well. You had to hold the handle down until it fully flushed. The lights in the ceiling fan didn't work so we had to get them fixed: one light bulb and one starter switch. Two washers and two dryers if you decide to do laundry. The bus stop is right out in front. There's a Subway just out front as well. The staff were super!!! I can't say enough on how friendly and helpful they were. If you have kids and aren't into the night life, then don't stay here. It doesn't quiet down until 4 AM.

My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club. The cons to this property are as follows:The rooms are small. The 3 of us just barely fit and I would not try to fit a fourth. The Murphy bed is not what the average person is used to. Personally I sleep on a king sized pillow top foam mattress at home. The furnishings are dated. Think Starsky and Hutch or Hawaii Five-O. No pool. No activities to speak of. The neighborhood is a little sketchy.That being said the rooms are OK for two people and they are clean. If you request an egg crate foam mattress topper the bed is quite tolerable. This is not a luxury resort where you would loll around and soak up the ambiance. As far as the neighborhood goes one must remember that Waikīkī is the tourist district of Honolulu, located between the Ala Wai Canal and the Pacific Ocean next to Diamond Head. Numerous hotels, shops, and nightlife opportunities are located along Kalakaua and Kuhio Avenues. It is a popular location for visitors and locals alike and attracts millions of visitors every year. The attraction here is Oahu and Waikiki Beach. Like any large city (2011 census estimate over 936,000) you find the homeless, prostitution and crime. You also find this in Small Town USA. Due vigilance is required. Being central to all of the activities is the biggest assest this property has. The second biggest is the staff who embody the true Aloha spirit and bend over backwards to accommodate you. They have beach chairs, umbrellas, coolers and coolers available to rent which was very handy. I would not recommend this property to everyone. For the young party crowd it works extremely well. Even a couple if you truly are there to see Oahu and only sleep in the room. Overall I would give it a 2 ½ star rating and that high because of the location and the staff. I’ve stayed in much worse RCI properties in Cape Cod and AAA recommended hotels in the US.

Just stayed a week there, We read the reviews and was prepared for the worst, The noise on the street was the worst. You could not asked for a Better staff anywhere. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, it was the best. I really did not see the strip club.We did not plan to stay in the room all that much anyway, The air did cut on and off at night. It is not the Hyatt by no means. RCI in Gulf Shores Ala. Was not much better. As the saying goes, you get what you pay for.

We booked this through RCI and I am really surprised that this is even listed by them. Really really surprised. Lots of other reviewers mentioned the questionable night life and noise from the bar. I can not comment to that as I refused to stay here. The staff was very friendly and greeted us with orchid leis and that was the last good experience I had there. I knew we had gotten a good rate on this accommodation however I would not stay or recommend to anyone to stay there again. It is desperate for renovations! Hawaii was amazing and we found lots of nice places that kept us away from our hotel from morning till night!

review_body: The reviews I read had me worried for nothing. A freind is an owner and got my husband and I a great deal on one of the rooms. We are in our 40s & would not recommmend this place for kids due to no pool and location at night. We paid no extra fees like the other review mentioned, not sure if they had another type of rental agreement. This motel/hotel is in the heart of Waikiki close to everything you want to do. I never saw a cockroach & we evaluated for bed bugs and found none. Yes a night club is downstairs, but never heard a thing and we were directly above it. Hookers & homeless...yep saw them on Kuhio Ave. & on the beachwalk by the higher priced hotels. The place was dated but clean and everything worked in the room. No Shampoo/cond. but soap and towels provided daily. Hotel Security was always walking at night and you needed a seperate key for the outside door and your room. Yes it was the old style keys, but it is an old hotel. Beach towels available at the front desk but you had to keep them for the week. Washer & dryer available but always in use. Boogie Boards free to use at the front desk. Snorkel rental around the corner. Every place you want to eat right near your room. We saved a ton of money staying here and basically only slept in our room. We went to the North Shore and spend $300 on a room at Turtle Bay Resort which was really nice with an oceanview.....However, we felt like we needed to hang out in our room or at least at the hotel to get our moneys worth. If you plan to hangout in your room/resort and not explore Oahu then spend the increase money. Otherwise stay at the Kuhio Banyan Club & save your money for activities, food and rental cars. Check out the Tiki Bar at Aston Hotel we really liked it! Aloha

We stayed at the Kuhio Banyan in mid January 2012. This place is not nice and we did find cockroaches in the room but no bed bugs as other reviews have mentioned....and we searched thoroughly. The carpet was old and very dirty as were the furnishings. The paint near light switches and doors was discolored from dirt and grime. Housekeeping only comes on Tuesday and they count and re-count every single towel and washcloth with stern warnings that you will pay dearly if one disappears. The nightclub/strip club on the ground floor is so loud some nights that the ineffective air conditioner is not even loud enough to drown out the noise. We did not even stay for the entire time we had the place reserved. We were out of there before sunrise and did not return until after dark. Waikiki beach was within about 4 blocks so it was easy to get to although crowded as usual. Not much good to say about the Kuhio Banyan. Several other guests that are affiliated with RCI told us that this place was hands down the worst RCI property they have been to....by a long shot. Other properties are within about 15 feet of his building and contain a multitude of interesting folks, long term renters I think. Each morning we were greeted by 10 or 20 minutes of coughing and hacking from one of the nearby chain smokers who had to clear a substantial amount of gunk from his lungs. The bus route is directly in front of the building and busy 24 hours a day making for lots of noise. Parking is awful if you rent a car and very expensive. The resort will nickel and dime you nearly to death at check in with additional fees and charges. We will not return to this place ever again and will discourage everyone we know from staying here.
Would only go to save on rooms if I was with a couple of male friendsNot some place I would take a wife or girlfriend

As a young couple staying in Waikiki for a week, this place worked pretty well. It is a small space, but we didn't need much. Heads up, the refrigerator is small (like one you'd find in a standard hotel) so don't expect to store much in it. It contains only one window AC unit, but since it was a studio space, it worked just fine to cool the place down. If you plan to spend your vacation in your room, then you won't enjoy your time here. We only used our room to sleep and shower, otherwise we were out enjoying the sites, and therefore didn't mind the small space. We did enjoy the close proximity of restaurants, shopping, beaches, things to do, and bus routes to our room. The gentleman on site who assisted us in planning our day trips was very helpful and we greatly appreciated his expertise. We did not have a vehicle with us and we're glad we didn't. Parking availability is low since it is downtown Honolulu. That's why we enjoyed being able to walk everywhere or jumping on the bus that stops right out front! Overall, this space isn't high class by any means, but it worked great for us who hardly spent any time there.

If your looking for a 5 star timeshare then don't waste your time here. I am a little surprised that RCI even lists this property. First let me tell you the bad, but please keep reading till the end. This property is old and is in desperate need of an update. I mean desperate!! The carpet needs replacing and the rooms need to be gutted and redone. at one end is a nightclub, it is close to a busy street and yes at night there are "ladies of the evening trying to make some money out on the street. These rooms should only be listed as max 2 not 4.There are no views of anything pretty. The tv is small, there is no oven and it has a mini-fridge. When you go out the front door you are looking at the back of an unattractive apt bldg. There are no internet connection in the rooms.Now let me tell you about the good, LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!! You are across the street from the international market, There is a Chilis, drugstore, gracery store, Starbucks, Dennys, Subway, ATM,ABC store and more restraunts all within two blocks. Cut through the market and you can be on Kalakaua street in about 3-5 min and be at Waikiki within 5-10 min. I have never had any trouble with the staff. They have all been very nice and helpful when we have stayed there. Our room this month was very clean(yes it was very dated but it was clean). The murphy bed was comfortable, We both slept well The sheets were fresh and we didn't find any bed bugs. the little window unit kept it cool enough. My wife didn't like her pillow, we called the front desk and within 5 min they brought a new one up. They have a security guard at night and you need a key to get in the bldg at all times. I have never felt unsafe here. Hint; when making a reservation ALWAYS request 3rd or 4th floor and as far away from the nightclub as possible. We did and had no problem, we were on the third floor. I have never had any problem with outside noise. The Banyan will never be my first choice when going to Honolulubut i would stay there again. We are never in our room that much. No doubt one day it wii probably be torn down and replaced with a newer more modern bldg.

I was totally shocked that a hotel such as this would be available through RCI as we have stayed at beautiful properties in the past! Upon inital check of the bed linen found a live bedbug scurring for cover!!! The office staff offered another room where we also found signs of bed bugs and no shower curtain. The other reviews of this property are not exagerating at all! We had to find another hotel to stay at immediatly upon arrival! This experience could have easily ruined our trip right from the start!!!!

My husband and I and another couple were scheduled to stay for a week. At the last minute the other couple had to cancel. This place, however, was the worst that I've ever stayed in and will never return if this was the last place in Oahu. It's worth it to pay the extra money for the peace of mind.

We (My Wife and I) Checked in to the Kuhio Banyan Club after a wonderful week in Kuai. I was Apalled at the $8 per day for the privvilage of checking out an iron or any thing else that is normally furnished and included in timeshares. Next,after I found the bed in the wall and pulled it down, the doors blocked the TV. The couch was too worn out to sit on but the bed was worse.Obviously unabl to sleep I went out on the balcony. Looking down into the entry way, there was a drunk spralled out on the curb sorround a tree and two prostitutes hanging around. Early AM I called RCI and stated that I was "OUT OFTHERE" and they said the would try to find us someting else and they did. It's about two blocks down the street and I would Highly recommend it. It was called Kuhio Towers. It's obvious that Kuhio Banyan Club is normally rented out by the hour.

After reading some reviews here and on other sites, I was very hesitant about staying here. I had decided to go ahead and give the place a try.When my party and I, 3 total, first checked in, we were warmly greeted. They gave us two sets of keys, a tv remote, and a card key for the room safe. I was a little surprised to see each set of keys had two keys attached to the ring. I was told one was for the room, and the other was for the main door after it was locked at night. That's right; there is no 24/7 service here. Staff is there from 7am to 10pm each day. If you're out past 10pm, you need a key to get back into the place. Don't have it? You're probably going to have to call someone from staff to drive all the way out to this place and let you back in, which can be up to a 2 hour wait and a $45 charge. I made sure to have my key on my person at all times so I wouldn't end up in this predicament.The single elevator here is the smallest I've ever seen. It didn't smell when I got on it, but the carpet certainly looked old. Me and my group were squeezed tightly into the small space of the elevator as we made our way up to our room, which was on the top-most floor.Now the balcony leading to the room, there was a neighboring building right in front of us which looked like a residential building. I couldn't tell exactly if this really was Section 8 housing as another reviewer brought up. The entire time I was here, I didn't really see any residents out. However, there were two nights I heard a young woman arguing on a phone about some troubled relationship of hers. It sounded like it was coming straight from this residential building. This was around 4am in the morning. But this is nothing. There are a couple of bars nearby the Banyan, blaring music early in the night with people loudly talking and laughing up a storm. The first few nights I stayed here, I had trouble sleeping, but got quickly adjusted to it and it didn't bother me.Moving on to the room, when I first entered it, it was clean. The furniture and carpet seriously are old and worn, though. They're simply begging to be replaced. The bathroom was nice save for the grungy shower tiles. They looked as though they haven't been cleaned in a decade. I didn't dare step barefoot onto them but rather wore an old pair of sandals while showering.I did stumble upon a baby cockroach one evening in the bathroom. It scared the life out of me before shooting into a crack in the wall. Luckily, I had some boric acid on hand. I sprinkled a little around the cracks and didn't see another cockroach (I also made sure to keep the entire unit tidy as possibile).The entire place is a small step up from a Motel 6, but only by a hair. It was still comfy, so I tried not to make a fuss much. I didn't stay here too much, only as a place to sleep in mostly. The two things I liked about this place were the staff and most importantly, the location. The staff were very helpful in any questions I had, including different destinations and the different routes aboard the Bus. For location, many shops are so close by, as well as numerous restaurants. The beach is a short walk away, too.Although the Kuhio Banyan wasn't too far from many local attractions and the unit had a few extras such as a stove-top burner (pretty basic; see photos to get an idea what they look like), I'd be hesitant to recommend this place to others. To be honest, I'm drawn down the line as to whether I'd tell people to look elsewhere or to give this place a shot. The few perks of this place had won me over somewhat, but then again, the cons, such as that roach, the loud night noise, and let me not forget to mention that one bum constantly wandering in front of the Banyan, have me disliking this place. What I will recommend to travelers out there is to definitely do your homework and look for a good deal on a nice hotel. If by the chance you're not able to come across anything you like, only then would I recommend the Kuhio Banyan as a fair location to try.

The hotel is actually a old motel 6. It has a horrible evening life because of the street walkers and the loitering party cloud. The unit was damp and old with the most outdated decor. This is not a quality vacation experiance. I would have done better sleeping at the beach and using the room for a closet. Don't try to justify this hotel as just a place to sleep.

In spite of the bad reviews, we went ahead and stayed as an RCI exchange. We weren't sure what to expect so were pleasently surprised when we arrived to a welcoming check-in, a clean room and an outstanding location. Folks who are upset at their less than palatial surroundings should get a clue by the amount of points required to stay there. The floors were clean, the counters were clean, the refrigerator worked, the bathroom was clean. It isn't the Ritz. In fact, our home resort is beachfront on another island. But, if one is intent on staying in Waikiki, they could do a lot worse (we have in the past). The only drawback we could find was the necessity of keeping the air conditioner on 24/7, as there is no ventilation. Again, one is downtown so open windows aren't quite as nice as they are on a beach. The Kuhio Banyan is a couple of notches above Motel 6, without the pool. And, even most of the hotels in Waikiki depend on A/C, and dicourage open lanai doors.That said, TheBus is absolutely fantastic. $2.50 per adult one way anywhere a tourist would like to go and all of the routes from Waikiki stop directly in front. The 2 Bus travels to many of the most desireable locations and runs every 10-15 minutes (no way to really keep a schedule in that traffic). With public transportation like this, there is no need for a rental car unless you just have to have one - and parking is horrible. Spend $5 at the ABC store and get TheBus Map and Guide Book.To sum up, as the realtors say, location, location, location. Lots of great shows, restaurants and shops within easy walking distance, from a clean location. (Never saw any hookers and I think the nightclub is either defunct or tamed.)

When we checked in, we then found out we had to put a security deposit of $250, plus daily rental and tax fees ($11.69/day) on top of it, for each studio. Finally we grabbed our keys (yes, they still use door keys), remote for the TV, and safe key.We went to our rooms and traveled up to the third floor, in a smelly sickening elevator. The whole stay was UNACCEPTABLE and I hold RCI responsible for NOT providing any QUALITY CONTROL on their Resorts.

I was there in 2010 .after reading all the updated reviews nothing has changed.! The elevator is very small an dark will carry only 3 people without luggage., no views, and the back side of the Kuhio there is a buidling ?apts with junk and garbage on there balconies which you see every time you enter/ leave the room.

This place is in a sad state of disrepair. Our room was on the 3rd floor, better to take the stairs as the elevator is tiny and completely covered in old carpet. At the back of the condo you look down on trash filled patios, the front window looks out onto the roof of a Subway. In the morning we saw homeless going through the trash. The furniture is beat up, and worn. The cleanliness is questionable, we never took of our socks. The murphy bed was so bad, we slept on the 2 sofas, only to be woken at 3:30am by a bar fight from the adjoining night club. The rooms still use keys, and only have a safety chain, no dead bolt. There is no night staff after 10pm. We did not feel safe in this area at all. RCI's computer was down, so we had to stay one night, thankfully the next morning we spoke to a very understanding supervisor, who could only move us to another island , so instead returned our week and exchange fee. We ended up having to pay for a hotel for the duration of our stay, not something we had budgeted for. It's a crime that RCI does not require it's properties to meet some kind of standard.

I went there just for one night, although the recent reviews were negative. I thought it was going to be fine for one night. The staff is very nice and really helps you with good advices. They provide for free towels and umbrellas for the beach, which adds value. The Kuhio Banyan had old wall papers, stairs in not so good state, however it seemed it was going to be ok considering the services it provide. The kitchen corner of the room had virtually everything you could think of, and the bathroom was big. The place is not new, but it appeared clean.In the night, however, I came back to the room and about 20 baby roaches were hanging out in the sink of the kitchen corner. I woke up at 6 next morning and left as soon as possible, glad I had to stay there only for one night.I'm sorry for the staff, but I raccomand not to go there.

OMG How could world mark have any association with the kuhio banyan? It looks like a homeless shelter, not I think the homeless shelter are probably a little more upscale. Someone from world amrk needs to go and take a look at this hotel. the way they publize it and the picture they show are not what it really is like. There are lots of good deals in the area. Save your points if you are using world mark points and use them somewhere else. This hotel is disgusting and for World Mark and RCI using this location does not do anything good for the creditbility.

Unfortunately we took an RCI Cruise and Stay package. We arrived at this hotel only to meet a couple who had been given a 'chemical bomb' to get rid of the cockroaches in their room! The housekeeping staff had left so they were expected to leave while the the room was fumigated and then come back and clean it up. We moved out and went to another hotel. We found the Kuhio Banyon to be horrible and RCI shouldn't have it in their inventory. Yes, it is close to the beach, but also beside a noisy nightclub. We did not get our money back, RCI gave us a week to use in the future but still a big rip-off. We were told by one of the local travel people that the Moms break down in tears when they realize this is where the family is booked for their vacation.

How to put this nicely? A DUMP!!! This is the second time that RCI falsely sang the praises of one of their timeshares. The only positive about this facility is location...that is it! When we arrived, we had trouble finding the front door...it is sandwiched between street front shops and a Title 8 motel. There are no views whatsoever nor atmosphere. When we checked in, we entered the smallest and smelliest elevator...I knew we were in trouble. Upon entering our unit, it had a very strong odor of air freshener...to cover what kind of smells, I have no idea! The unit is so small, that you sleep on a queen murphy bed...mattress was too hard for us. We attempted to use the twin beds that were the couches....once you removed the cushions, you were sleeping, literally inches from the floor. The pillows provided were "pancakes" and needless to say...we did not sleep. Being senior citizens, I knew this would not work for us. Our first complaint call to RCI...a supervisor named Don....assured us nothing else was available. The next morning, I tried to fit in the shower, and could not...the shower is 3' x 3'...seriously!!! This time, I...not my wife...called to complain that this would not do.....how disturbed that I was placed in a dump and demanded to be moved. Luckily, this supervisor...Stephanie...put us immediately into the Royal Aloha Vacation Club. Now this is what Hawaii is all about...beautiful one bedroom condo with all the amenities.Be very careful with RCI....be sure to read ALL the reviews posted on Trip Advisor before accepting a trade. I even offered to send them pictures of this dump, but they didn't seem too interested....so, I felt I would write this review. This place, literally, needs to be torn down...completely rebuilt with LESS units so they can possibly reflect a liveable habitat.

We recently stayed at the Waikiki Banyon Hotel in a Time Share unit,. The unit itself was great. My issue is the parking. Whatever you do make sure you get a parking pass from the timeshare office. If you pay for parking inadvertantly they will not give you a refund. I had payed for weekly parking and went back after 10 minutes when I realized the parking was included and they refused to give a refund. the property general manger was very unprofessional. Timeshare office managers grumpy. Room was nice and clean. Great location, 3 min walk to beach and shops.

The worst place I have ever stayed in, in my life. I traded Christmas week in a luxury time share in San Francisco for the Roach motel. No where to park the car to even unload luggage. No staff after 9:00 p.m. The stereo only played tapes. Really!! Tapes?? Does anyone own a tape.?? The beds were like sleeping on a wooden slab with a grass mat. The place smelled badly. It was dirty. The carpeting must have been the original piece of carpeting invented and "still in place." No shampoo and conditioner. To get to your room you had to go by an apartment building that had balconies with people sleeping on them. There is a strip club right outside the door with scantily clad girls trying to lure people in. Not a family friendly location. If you want an extra towel, it is $2.50. Don'tgo there if you expect any kind of amenities. If RCI sticks you there demand to be moved. We arrived on Sat. afternoon and they moved us on Mon. morning to a very nice place. RCI needs to dump this place. It is not fair to RCI members, We pay a lot of money for these timeshares and they should be more discerning about there accommodatins or represent them as they really are.

If your looking for a luxury hotel then this is not the place for you. If your looking for some place to eat sleep and get back out and enjoy the island then this is the place for you. We visited Hawaii because we attended a wedding. I stayed here with my hubby and 2 year old son. While everyone else was stuck on some far part of the island. We were in the middle of everything. Everything was in walking distance from us. ATM, Any restaurant you can think of, the market, the malls and by the way the beach is just a hop skip and a jump. (1 block away) OMG.. If your looking for an upscale luxurious hotel then yea you will be disappointed. But why go to Hawaii, Waikiki to be in a luxury hotel and pay luxurious money when there is sooo much to see and do outside. Also I would suggest to plan your trips ahead of time. Apply for the go card so you can get a taste of every aspect of Hawaii if your into advertures definetly take a trip to the big islands. The tour guides/trips were very organized. Overall we had a phenominal time. I would def do it all over again.

review_body: Frankly I don't know why all the bad reviews, Kuhio Banyan is a very simple place. It is great for a jumping off place for all your site seeing. What more do you need. Great location, Very nice, helpful staff! Thanks Joanie, Jiselle and Andrew! Yes the place could use updating, but it was clean and had everything we needed, my only complaint is that the murphy bed was to hard for my tastes, but hey I was in Hawaii, and I had a great time. There are places to eat any where you walk, really loved the Seaside Restaurant, corner of Seaside and Kuhio, good food, nice staff, and Puka Dog at the entance to the International Market, Great dogs and the Best lemonade I've ever had.I will definitely go back if I ever get the chance, Thanks Kuhio Banyan!

Where to begin? For how much my husband and I pay for a timeshare, ANY timeshare in the RCI network should NOT look like this. I understood I took risks when I switched out, but I thought RCI had SOME standards. First of all, BUGS. I am a bug phobe. There were two baby cockroaches and a FULL sized one found in our one week stay (and by full size, I mean by Hawaiian standards. The kind that grow to deathly sizes). I pay for a two bedroom timeshare normally, but the bedrooms that they had in my building were awful. They didnt have a bedroom. Not kidding. There was a murphy bed (one that comes from the wall), and two that were created if you removed the couch cushions, and I dont mean fold-out. The kitchen was well stocked, and the staff was nice. However, it doesnt help if the staff is nice if there is only one, to two people working. Lines were always horrendous at the front desk. Furthermore, my husband was born and raised in Hawaii, so he is by all standards "local," and there is some stigma to being in Waikiki. If you are looking to do tourist things, then Waikiki is the place to be, but it is by no means "authentic Hawaii." If you are looking for authentic Hawaii, please travel beyond the borders of Waikiki. ONE OF THE WORST things were the prostitutes. In my fathers days, the prostitutes congregated on Hotel St. NOW they are on KUHIO Ave!!!! Their Samoan pimp and his backup were on every corner. If I weren't with my husband he would have gotten mobbed by prostitutes!!!!!!!!! It was also very crappy to stay on back side of the building. You are literally about 6 feet from the balcony of section 8 housing. Beware! Theres even underwear in the TREE inbetween the two balconies...unable to be retrieved and removed!!!If you DO want Waikiki its the place to be, but DO NOT expect luxury!!!!!! The only good thing I have to say is that the kitchen was well stocked and the staff was nice.ALSO, NO PARKING!!!! You can pay for a garage nearby THROUGH Kuhio Banyan Club, at a cheap 14 dollars a day about two blocks away. Thats not too bad, but dont expect any parking AT Kuhio!!!

I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club in Nov 2009 for 1 week on an RCI exchange. It was a wonderful location in the heart of Waikiki Beach, and yes it was hard to find as it does not really look like a hotel the way the entrance is. Out front is a court yard area, a night club, nail Salon and a Subway, on the corner of the block is an amazing Philly Cheesesteak Place with good food for decent prices.The staff were helpful and very friendly and the rental of the beach chairs, boogie boards etc was awesome to have.The room was disappointing, I "think" it was clean but really can't be sure as everything was so old and worn it didn't "feel" clean. We used the fridge but I would not have wanted to cook anything there, and I wore my flip flops to shower....The bed had the topper on it and was comfortable.We didn't spend a lot of time here so it wasn't a big deal but I don't know that I would stay here again....

The equivalent of a roach motel at its best, but sometimes budget leaves no choice..........why pay $150 + + for other hotels when you are in Waikiki, out of your room most of the day sightseeing and on the beach??? Location of this hotel can't be beat for the price, though if you really think of all the fees you pay for maintenance fee on your own resorts, this is not a cheap stay. It is upsetting.......to say the leastWe looked at the reviews, but nothing compared to the shock when we walked in. I was in the military and backed packed quite a bit, but my daughter, you could see the disappointment in her eyes. What saved me the next day was the location. You are right on Waikiki, and I had the GO Oahu card, had arranged all the tours, therefore we only came in to sleep. Not the most comfortable sleep, a Murphy bed, with a TV that you can't watch once you open the bed, but we were so tired from our day out that it really did not matter. I only recommend this "resort" Ha ha ha......if you are on a budget. Staying here allowed us to do other things. Oahu is expensive, if you are traveling with kids, bring cereal to get you started on your day. A box of cheerios or Honey clusters is $7.00 milk $9.00 gallon........ peanut butter 3.00 for an 8oz as well as jelly same price. International Market across the street, thursdays is farmers market, lots of reasonable priced fruit, after paying 3.80 for two apples, 99cents for a banana. The staff was friendly, that and the location made up for the terrible accommodations. They should at least splurge on replacing the mattress and replacing the covers on the small couches. The bathrooms also need a lot of help. I had second thoughts about sitting on the couch. Ok for two people, but 4 would be impossible.......The 19 takes you from and to the airport, no need to pay for a shuttle unless you have lots of luggage. Roberts Hawaii dominates the sightseeing market and they are the most reasonable for airport shuttle, I think 15 or 16 bucks round trip. 19 bus $2.25 stops right in-front of the "resort" ha ha ha. No need to rent a car. The Bus and the trolly's take you everywhere. I would recommend this only if you are on a budget. Hawaii is over rated...... Oh! you have to pay, an additonal $70 something for the use of beach towels, chairs, and hotel tax. You have to "sign out the blow dryer, iron, ironing board. No shampoo, and cheap soap so take your own. Sun screen is not expensive is the same price and you don't take the chance of the airport personnel keeping your sun screen...... Subway in the complex, as well as a Japanese take our fast food, pretty good and reasonable. Also they have a restaurant similar to Benihana's that was good and reasonable. I think the name was Takana or Tanaka??? sp

When we first arrived the door was locked because our flight was late. We had to stand on the curb for 3 hours until someone came to open the office. While waiting there was a homeless person on the steps of the hotel throwing up. We then entered the most claustraphobic (sp?) elevator in the world. You have to make two trips to get two people and suitcases upstairs(slim people). We unlocked our room door (lock looks like a bathroom lock) and walked back into the late 70s early 80s. The room was clean but the stained carpets and chairs did not feel clean. The bathroom tiles were mildewed. Needless to say, we left to stay at the Marriott on the beach. This hotel is two blocks from the beach. The hotel is okay if you are drunk frat boys looking for a place to "crash" for spring break.

Vintage 70's or early 80's decor...ok for a middle aged couples. Right on the main Waikiki strip 2 blocks from the beach and shopping. Beds were acceptable but not great. Clean and useful kitchen and bathroom. Free safe in the room. Good security. Very good service. We requested and got a wireless modem for a cheap price for the entire week. Very friendly staff. They extended our stay until evening of our flight without any charge. We would stay again...without the teenagers with us.

My husband and I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club for a week at the beginning of December. Overall, we had a nice time. The rooms are very small, which was fine with us, since there were only two of us. They could use a little updating though. There were some stains on the rug, but nothing major. There is a small kitchen which had everything you should need, including silverware, dishes, glasses and some pots and pans. There is also a laundry room (to wash was $1.25 and to dry was $ .75), which was nice to have. The murphy bed was fine, our only gripe was that the tv is right next to the bed, so when you pulled the bed out, both people couldn't see the tv when you were lying there. You had to have your head at the opposite end of the bed to be able to see it, and even then, only one person could see it due to the closet doors (that hold the bed in) being in the way. To some this may not be a big deal, but we like to lay in bed and watch tv!The location is right downtown, and only two blocks from the beach. We personally had a little trouble finding the entrance. It's set amid a little strip mall, and we literally had to go around the block 5 or 6 times before we found it, and then there was no place to park.If you love shopping and going out at night, this is a great place for you. We personally like to be a little more secluded, and are not really into the night scene, so this wasn't a great selling point for us. There is a nightclub at the one end of the hotel, and, even though we were at the total opposite end, we could still hear the music late at night. Luckily when the air conditioner kicked on, it covered it up for the most part, but not entirely. There is also a bus stop right outside, which would be great for people who would want to use it. The International Marketplace is right across the street, and there are tons and tons of shops and restaurants within walking distance.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We received a beautiful lei when we checked in. They have beach chairs, umbrellas, coolers and other items to rent which was extremely helpful. It was so nice not to have to buy these items, then worry about what we were going to do with them once we leave. I believe a previous reviewer said that the cost of these was around $70, but I believe that price was for the Hawaii hotel tax, not for the equipment rental. I'm pretty sure that I remember the lady at the desk saying that $7.50 covered the costs of the chairs and things, but I can't be 100% sure. I'm sure if you called them you could confirm this detail.Paying over $100 to park for the week did not excite me, but if you don't get a rental car, obviously you wouldn't have to deal with this.The Kuhio Banyan is pretty much a no frills place. If you want luxury, you are not going to find it here. If you basically want a place to sleep at night after shopping, being on the beach, eating out and clubbing, then you will be fine here. We were gone pretty much all day, and really only slept there, so for us, it was fine. Also, It's probably not a great family place, just because of the noise from the nightclub and that there is no pool.

My daughter and I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club 5-12 Sept. I needed to use an RCI week and was heading to Waikiki anyway and that was all that was available for that particular week which I needed. Thanks to other reviews on trip advisor, I knew to ask for the egg crate foam for the murphy bed mattress which was too hard for me as I realized the first night. I called the front desk the first morning I was there and the foam was added to my bed and remade before I got back from the activities briefing --very responsive. The rooms are small --OK for two people --but would be crowded for more even though the couch and loveseat turn into twin beds. The closet is in the bathroom. The rooms were clean and the location is great with the bus stops just outside. We rented a car only one day because we didn't want to deal with the parking issue and we'd been there before and didn't need to use the bus too much. (THE BUS only takes what luggage you could carry on to a plane.) The backpack beach chairs were nice and other equipment is available but each room is required to pay the same fee upon check out (I think it was about $70) which covered use of equipment whether you use it or not. If this were the only RCI condo available, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
